revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-14 12:57:45.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Multiple csnat ports created when RouterPort table update fails

When router interfaces are added to DVR router, if the router has
gateway configured, then the internal csnat ports are created for
the corresponding router interfaces.
We have seen recently after the csnat port is created if the
RouterPort table update fails, there is a DB retry that is happening
and that retry operation is creating an additional csnat port.
This additional port is not getting removed automatically when the
router interfaces are deleted.
This issue is seen when testing with a simple heat template as
per the bug report.

This patch fixes the issue by calling the RouterPort create with
delete_port_on_error context.

Change-Id: I916011f2200f02556ebb30bce30e349a8023602c
Closes-Bug: #1709774
(cherry picked from commit 8c3cb2e15b48f5e2b0c3d22550f00f3c7adc7f33)

commit_message:
DVR: Multiple csnat ports created when RouterPort table update fails

When router interfaces are added to DVR router, if the router has
gateway configured, then the internal csnat ports are created for
the corresponding router interfaces.
We have seen recently after the csnat port is created if the
RouterPort table update fails, there is a DB retry that is happening
and that retry operation is creating an additional csnat port.
This additional port is not getting removed automatically when the
router interfaces are deleted.
This issue is seen when testing with a simple heat template as
per the bug report.

This patch fixes the issue by calling the RouterPort create with
delete_port_on_error context.

Conflicts:
        neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py

Change-Id: I916011f2200f02556ebb30bce30e349a8023602c
Closes-Bug: #1709774
(cherry picked from commit 8c3cb2e15b48f5e2b0c3d22550f00f3c7adc7f33)
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Ushanov <gm.mephisto@gmail.com>

subject: Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-10 22:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-11 07:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-10-11 13:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 22:11:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)

[{'created': '2019-10-11 16:12:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7d30926601775ce061cdaace73289c690ccf87b8

commit_message:
Skip pool-manager-cache-sync for >= Rocky

At Rocky, the use of the pool-manager service was dropped; ensure
that the sync step is a no-op as at Train this command has also
been removed and is no longer required if the pool-manager is not
in use.

Change-Id: If819c9abbff61134c2c689a5ab9f0872be937d34
Closes-Bug: 1847767

commit_message:
Add NeutronPermittedEthertypes on OVS agent

Adds support for configuring additional ethernet types in neutron
security groups. See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668224 for related
neutron change.

Note: this backports a change that involves a file merge and restructuring
(puppet/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml=>deployment/neutron-ovs-agent-container-puppet.yaml)

Related-Bug: #1832758
Conflicts:

commit_message:
Ensure nova-api is running before starting nova-compute containers

If nova-api is delayed starting then the nova_wait_for_compute_service
can timeout. A deployment using a slow/busy remote container repository is
particularly susceptible to this issue. To resolve this nova_compute and
nova_wait_for_compute_service have been postponed to step_5 and a task
has been added to step_4 to ensure nova_api is active before proceeding.

Change-Id: I6fcbc5cb5d4f3cbb618d9661d2a36c868e18b3d6
Closes-bug: #1842948

commit_message:
Add cache_image() support to the compute/{rpcapi,api,manager}

This provides the compute/api and compute/rpcapi plumbing to call
cache_image() on a given compute node. It also defines the status
information that we return to the caller to indicate what has been done.

Related to blueprint image-precache-support

Change-Id: If373fedb8d2e0dfc46b8ac5b018f8216aa5c643c

commit_message:
Switch to openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs

Neutron was using train jobs template: openstack-python3-train-jobs
but now we are in Ussuri cycle so let's switch to new template.

Change-Id: I99d9a048cab9d101740d96aa422f6fe596357c26

commit_message:
Add cache_image() driver method and libvirt implementation

This adds a new virt driver method for pre-caching an image, as well
as an implementation for libvirt. This will remain unimplemented in
any driver that does not provide image caching functionality or does
not support pre-caching of images.

Related to blueprint image-precache-support

Change-Id: I52fbbcac9dc386f24ee81b3321dd0d8355e01976

messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-10 22:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-11 07:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:00:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-10-11 13:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 22:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 20:21:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
(cherry picked from commit e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41)
(cherry picked from commit 57b127459189e39e993426f8e401e288f6394d4b)
(cherry picked from commit 9e5d33ac244e8dce31ff6d2c7119ee4bd53a9908)
(cherry picked from commit 0fdff12b260550190be01c59080a8be0c109db28)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
(cherry picked from commit e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41)
(cherry picked from commit 57b127459189e39e993426f8e401e288f6394d4b)
(cherry picked from commit 9e5d33ac244e8dce31ff6d2c7119ee4bd53a9908)
(cherry picked from commit 0fdff12b260550190be01c59080a8be0c109db28)

commit_message:
[Queens] Run cellv2 host discovery via workflow or deploy_steps_tasks

This is a queens only modified version of
https://review.opendev.org/682644 due to the different deployment
methods we have there.

When the compute bootstrap node gets blacklisted or deployment is
run with skip-deploy-identifier the discovery job we have in step_5
won't run. This runs the the discovery via an ansible playbook to
make sure it runs in this conditions.

In case of default deploy method the discovery is run by the
discovery workflow.

In case of config-download the discovery is run via the
deploy_steps_tasks.

Change-Id: Icda4c1eb3e8c39a01547586dbc6f0407ce846c64
Closes-Bug: #1831711
Depends-On: I54d42df162a6744806301d97bca5d94e5f380a2b

commit_message:
Remove unreferenced document table and image files

As those files are not referenced anywhere within this repository
we can get rid of them. This is a follow up of the findings
during the review of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687491/


Change-Id: Ic2d5e52a7c8b8cf2f230f6a2b440d29ebb6de3f5

Can you please help me understand (link to docs or something) why `extras` exists and when/why it's preferable to having these things in test-requirements? Because at a glance, it seems like it would be more maintainable to have all the test requirements in one place.

In particular, when we need to bump a minimum, does this mean we need to hit tox.ini+lower-constraints.txt rather than the usual [test-]requirements.txt+lower-constraints.txt?"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-26 16:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Can you please help me understand (link to docs or something) why
 > `extras` exists and when/why it's preferable to having these things
 > in test-requirements? Because at a glance, it seems like it would
 > be more maintainable to have all the test requirements in one
 > place.
 > 
 > In particular, when we need to bump a minimum, does this mean we
 > need to hit tox.ini+lower-constraints.txt rather than the usual
 > [test-]requirements.txt+lower-constraints.txt?

Tbh, the fact we use this in opportunistic testing for both unit and functional tests makes this basically worthless. I'm going to keep this open a while longer while I see if I can rework things to optionally override 'extras' but I doubt I'll have much luck :("}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-10-11 17:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
requirements: Move DB dependencies to 'extras'

This doesn't actually change anything much due to the need to continue
using these things for the opportunistic DB tests. However, it does
better isolate our dependencies from each other which seems like a good
thing.

Change-Id: I57ccb3eee2f25fe110b8afeb38fa84b6327faea1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

(7 comments)

in general i see what you are trying to do and for a very sepcifc usecase. A new cloud with no existing instance when pinned and non pinned guest will not be schduled to the same host. the patch you have proposed could solve the issue raised in https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1844721. however i have spent almost 4 hours working on this review instead of sleep and while i dont want to be condescending 
i think its clear from my responce that while i like the direction this is incomplete as you have not considerd all the edgecase that need to be consierd if you claim that this patch address both bugs.

the main gap is you have not adress the upgrade impact of this change or the mixed numa and non numa case. The PCPUs in placment feature addrees half of the problem with mixing numa and non numa instnace on the same host. the mempages aspect has not yet been adress as such it is still not safe to mix numa insance and non numa instance on the same host if the host has multiple numa nodes.

this patch does not change that.

the final comment i would make is this should be marked as work in progers with  WIP in the commit title until the unit tests are updated and i think we proably should have functional test too. over all i dont think this is backportable due to the fact it disable memory overcommit for pinned instances which i belive should be supported today.

i think this is some we should adress in U as part of tracking mempages in plamcent but i would not be against a small patch with test and release notes to fix your specific usecase but i think we shoudl handel existing instnace'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2019-10-02 18:07:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Sean,

Thank you so much for the detailed comments, I have carefully read and acknowledged them all.

I agree this patch is not to close bug 1439247, as a matter of fact, bug 1439247 is not a concern for me, none of our many operators bother to mixing numa and non-numa instances on the same compute, by comparison, 1844721 is a real field issue for us, that is the reason I was reluctant to see 1844721 tagged as a duplicate for 1439247.

I appreciate very much that you understand the patch totally, it is to address a real issue while not to break the "essence" of the existing "law and order".

If my understanding is correct, you are willing to allow the patch for 1844721 after I fix the unit test and the release note, I am willing to do that, otherwise please correct me.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-10-04 00:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

yes you understood my comments correctly.

i would be fine with this change if you added an upgrade impact release note, updated the unit tests adding an assertion for the new behaviour and correcting the current failing test.

the reno should detail that this will only take effect for new instances. to correct the numa resource tracking for existing instance we would need to regenerate the numa topology via a migration. however until https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662522/ is merged i dont think the topology will correctly be updated for a cold migrate or resize.
the newly added numa migration code might update the topology to include the pagesize but its not clear that it would need to call numa_get_constraints. the live migration code does need to calculate a new guest to host mapping but it does not expect the constraints to change as part of the live migration. in this case it would be changing form global 4k memory to numa local 4k memory so we would have to test that before suggesting this as workaound for existing instances. 

for this patch to close the bug and not just be partial bug i would additionally like to see a way to address existing instances running on a host. as such with the current code only partial addressed the bug rather then closes it. what would be need to support existing instance is effectively iterating over the instances an updating the instance pagesize in the instance numa toplogy and ensuring the host numa topology blob is updated. i think the periodic task that calculates resource usage might fix the later point but it wont update the instance numa toplogy.'}, {'account_id': 26124, 'date': '2019-10-07 15:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-02 01:36:53.000000000', 'message': 'Force small pages accounting for CPU pinned VMs so that memory can be reserved
on NUMA 0 for host processes.

When VM CPU is pinned, there is no way to reserve memory on NUMA 0:

> ram_allocation_ratio is ignored by the nova scheduler when VM CPU is pinned
> reserved_host_memory_mb is a global reservation

This leads to many VMs are scheduled on NUMA 0 while their memory needs are met
"globally".

When the system starts to take load, VMs' memory pages start to get allocated
on NUMA 0 to the extend that memory shortage occurs on NUMA 0 and OOM kicks in
to kill host processes.

It is agreed that the workaround is to use hw:mem_page_size=small, plus
reserved_huge_pages set to proper number of small pages on NUMA 0 in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I04bed3055de90b2372c2cb67f73090ad5568a52a
Closes-Bug: 1439247
Closes-Bug: 1844721
'}, {'created': '2019-10-04 00:28:04.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances

If VM CPU is pinned but mem_page_size is not set, many VMs can be scheduled on
NUMA 0 while their memory needs are met "globally" on the host as modified by
ram_allocation_ratio and reserved_host_memory_mb.

When the system starts to take load, VMs' memory pages start to get allocated
on NUMA0 to the extend that memory shortage occurs on NUMA 0 and OOM kicks in
to kill host processes.

It is agreed that the workaround is to use hw:mem_page_size=small, and setting
reserved_huge_pages for proper number of small pages on NUMA 0 in nova.conf.

This path is to default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances when it is
not set in order to avoid taking down VMs that have already been deployed in the
customer sites.

Change-Id: I04bed3055de90b2372c2cb67f73090ad5568a52a
Closes-Bug: 1844721
'}, {'created': '2019-10-08 02:17:16.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances

If VM CPU is pinned but mem_page_size is not set, many VMs can be scheduled
on a NUMA node while their memory needs are met "globally" on the host as
modified by ram_allocation_ratio and reserved_host_memory_mb.

When the system starts to take load, the allocated memroy for the affined
VMs can exceed the aviable memroy on a NUMA node. The OOM reaper runs per
NUMA node so when the NUMA local memory is exausted it can lead to the
kernel killing host processes.

The above issue can be mitigated by using hw:mem_page_size=small, and setting
reserved_huge_pages for small pages per NUMA node in nova.conf.

This patch is to default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances if it is
not set so as to avoid VNF impact and avoid taking down VMs that have already
been deployed in the customer sites.

Change-Id: I04bed3055de90b2372c2cb67f73090ad5568a52a
Partial-Bug: 1844721
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 02:32:57.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances

If VM CPU is pinned but mem_page_size is not set, many VMs can be scheduled
on a NUMA node while their memory needs are met "globally" on the host as
modified by ram_allocation_ratio and reserved_host_memory_mb.

When the system starts to take load, the allocated memroy for the affined
VMs can exceed the aviable memroy on a NUMA node. The OOM reaper runs per
NUMA node so when the NUMA local memory is exausted it can lead to the
kernel killing host processes.

The above issue can be mitigated by using hw:mem_page_size=small, and setting
reserved_huge_pages for small pages per NUMA node in nova.conf.

This patch is to default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances if it is
not set so as to avoid VNF impact and avoid taking down VMs that have already
been deployed in the customer sites.

Change-Id: I04bed3055de90b2372c2cb67f73090ad5568a52a
Partial-Bug: 1844721
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances

If VM CPU is pinned but mem_page_size is not set, many VMs can be scheduled
on a NUMA node while their memory needs are met "globally" on the host as
modified by ram_allocation_ratio and reserved_host_memory_mb.

When the system starts to take load, the allocated memroy for the affined
VMs can exceed the aviable memroy on a NUMA node. The OOM reaper runs per
NUMA node so when the NUMA local memory is exausted it can lead to the
kernel killing host processes.

The above issue can be mitigated by using hw:mem_page_size=small, and setting
reserved_huge_pages for small pages per NUMA node in nova.conf.

This patch is to default mem_page_size to small for pinned instances if it is
not set so as to avoid VNF impact and avoid taking down VMs that have already
been deployed in the customer sites.

Change-Id: I04bed3055de90b2372c2cb67f73090ad5568a52a
Partial-Bug: 1844721

@Douglas:
> Not sure if I understand your question, but if an invalid size is provided by the user for both extend or shrink operations, the share api [1][2] will raise an error.

I'm trying to ask a different question than what that answers :)

Suppose you have a share size 3TB and you try to shrink it to 1TB but actually 1.7 TB are actually being used.  What happens?  (API doesn't know actual usage, just what's in the database as the size.  Back end knows though, right?)"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-10-08 19:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I'm trying to ask a different question than what that answers :)
> Suppose you have a share size 3TB and you try to shrink it to 1TB but actually 1.7 TB are actually being used.  What happens?  (API doesn't know actual usage, just what's in the database as the size.  Back end knows though, right?)


IIRC ONTAP fails shrinking the share to a size less than used space [1] - Douglas - can you test this use case? We introduced the share state "shrinking_possible_data_loss" to handle this situation - the NetApp driver can take advantage of this state and be consistent with the other drivers. Currently, if the backend disallows shrinking the flexvol beyond used size, the share's state is set to "error".


[1] https://library.netapp.com/ecmdocs/ECMP1196986/html/GUID-24010000-3EEA-46AD-A35C-16D63D99F3D5.html'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2019-10-08 21:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > I'm trying to ask a different question than what that answers :)
 > > Suppose you have a share size 3TB and you try to shrink it to 1TB
 > but actually 1.7 TB are actually being used.  What happens?  (API
 > doesn't know actual usage, just what's in the database as the size.
 >  Back end knows though, right?)
 > 
 > 
 > IIRC ONTAP fails shrinking the share to a size less than used space
 > [1] - Douglas - can you test this use case? We introduced the share
 > state "shrinking_possible_data_loss" to handle this situation - the
 > NetApp driver can take advantage of this state and be consistent
 > with the other drivers. Currently, if the backend disallows
 > shrinking the flexvol beyond used size, the share's state is set to
 > "error".
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://library.netapp.com/ecmdocs/ECMP1196986/html/GUID-24010000-3EEA-46AD-A35C-16D63D99F3D5.html
@Tom, thanks for providing more details. For the scenario that you propose, the shrink operation fails at driver level, because ONTAP refuses to set the new volume size since its too small to hold the current data. After the operation, the share goes to 'shrinking_error' state.
I reproduce this scenario and paste the output here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/782273/

@Goutham, for sure the driver is not setting the correct share state, since it is suppose to be 'shrinking_possible_data_loss_error' instead of 'shrinking_error'.

Thanks you guys for raising this point.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-10-08 23:34:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> @Goutham, for sure the driver is not setting the correct share state, since it is suppose to be 'shrinking_possible_data_loss_error' instead of 'shrinking_error'.
> Thanks you guys for raising this point.

you're welcome, Please open a bug for this and fix it.."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-10-09 10:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, this change looks good to me and it does not cause the issue I pointed to, which will be handled via a separate bug.'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2019-10-11 17:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit e38c8b508ff0cd1f5ea81a0f566fd83fb0b069ce'}]

commit_message:
[NetApp] Allow extension/shrinking of NetApp replicated share

The NetApp ONTAP driver is now fixed to allow extension
and shrinking of share replicas after they get promoted.

Change-Id: Iea92feaf5894c10674d2ec4c1a4d7b0191e6d5b4
Closes-Bug: #1700871

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 22:09:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove backend spec from share type while creating replica

If a share type includes the share_backend_name spec,
the scheduler may fail to schedule share replicas unless
all backends in a replication domain share the same
value for the capability "share_backend_name". Having
the same "share_backend_name" isn't desirable all the
time.

Ignore the share_backend_name spec from share type
while creating replica, so the scheduler will filter
a available backend according to the selection policy.

Change-Id: Ic8f7e6230298c222cc6cb5e4e4e8189524aaa81f
Closes-Bug: #1634734
(cherry picked from commit 700c1a02f0a357312df8f47932f83e86a3d2dc86)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove backend spec from share type while creating replica

If a share type includes the share_backend_name spec,
the scheduler may fail to schedule share replicas unless
all backends in a replication domain share the same
value for the capability "share_backend_name". Having
the same "share_backend_name" isn't desirable all the
time.

Ignore the share_backend_name spec from share type
while creating replica, so the scheduler will filter
a available backend according to the selection policy.

Change-Id: Ic8f7e6230298c222cc6cb5e4e4e8189524aaa81f
Closes-Bug: #1634734
(cherry picked from commit 700c1a02f0a357312df8f47932f83e86a3d2dc86)

commit_message:
Install packages and load kernel modules before configuring sysctl.

Otherwise we run into dependency problems where a kernel module
may not be loaded yet. This results in the sysctl options not
existing yet in the virtual file system /proc/sys/.

Also add br_netfilter to the required modules for TripleO.
It is required for bridge-nf-call-* sysctl options to work.

Change-Id: Ia28f2fdef34e739801c51828c99e9e6598dd2efb
Related-Bug: #1843259
Signed-off-by: ekultails <ekultails@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-10-08 08:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313
(cherry picked from commit 3488479d06bc9fc39058532d29229b67f25d4ec0)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313
(cherry picked from commit 3488479d06bc9fc39058532d29229b67f25d4ec0)

commit_message:
CI: Use any_errors_fatal in pre.yml and run.yml

This ensures that failure of a single host fails the whole play at that
task. This can avoid confusing errors such as when the task
"Assert that the nodepool private IPv4 address is assigned" fails on one
host, causing subsequent errors on other hosts.

Note that this only affects the Zuul playbooks, not Kolla Ansible's
playbooks.

Change-Id: I77a6534dd2ddd188f795e17d17a44be249d01f31

commit_message:
Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313
(cherry picked from commit 3488479d06bc9fc39058532d29229b67f25d4ec0)

commit_message:
Fix swift-proxy-server memcached configuration

Currently, swift-proxy config uses hosts in the swift-proxy-server group
to generate the list of memcached servers. However, memcached is
deployed to hosts in the memcached group.

This change fixes the memcached_servers option for swift-proxy to be the
same as other services.

Change-Id: Ib850a1bb2a504ac3e1396846ca3f1d9a30e8fca0
Closes-Bug: #1774313
(cherry picked from commit 3488479d06bc9fc39058532d29229b67f25d4ec0)

subject: Set subnet_per_namespace
messages:
[{'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-09-15 12:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-09-24 14:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-09-25 05:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-09-25 06:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-09-25 07:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-09-25 07:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-09-25 15:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Are we sure this is what we want? I though namespace tests will not work with network policies as namespace isolation is not enforced there? Moreover I see kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized-network-policy is not running TestNamespaceScenario, so the commit message title is at least misleading.

Can someone take me through the rationale to do this?'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-09-25 16:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Yes, this is wrong as we discussed on irc/slack. We should differentiate 3 cases:
- namespace sg and subnet driver enabled --> for namespace gates
- network policy sg driver enabled (which forces namespace subnet driver to be enabled) --> for network policy gates
- just subnet driver enabled (regardless of namespace isolation or network policy) --> for pool gate'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-10-07 09:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4727, 'date': '2019-10-07 09:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-08 08:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-11 14:18:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Seems a bit odd to start with setting an option that not yet exists in Tempest, but it's no harm we do it like that."}]

[{'created': '2019-09-20 09:46:59.000000000', 'message': 'Replace StandaloneLocalMtu with InterfaceLocalMtu

This patch replaces `StandaloneLocalMtu` with `InterfaceLocalMtu` in the
config jinja files. `StandaloneLocalMtu` has been shipped
as the parameter to specify MTU, although the correct one is
`InterfaceLocalMtu`.

Change-Id: I1cd769666567320ddad98ef2b12995e5749f6428
Closes-Bug: #1844167
'}]
commit_message:
Replace StandaloneLocalMtu with InterfaceLocalMtu

This patch replaces `StandaloneLocalMtu` with `InterfaceLocalMtu` in the
config jinja files. `StandaloneLocalMtu` has been shipped
as the parameter to specify MTU, although the correct one is
`InterfaceLocalMtu`.

Change-Id: I1cd769666567320ddad98ef2b12995e5749f6428
Closes-Bug: #1844167

commit_message:
Fix multiple-nics network config ExternalMtu

The external network is used for the external bridge
in OVN and DVR usecase. Controlled by external_bridge
tag in the role.

For this to work we also need to include the ExternalMtu
parameter when external_bridge tag is present.

Closes-Bug: #1847360
Change-Id: I93d5bfb540d298765ebc35d7596b214271f07dca

commit_message:
Fixing typos and spelling errors in driver template files

* Changing the reference to 'Atomic' in the k8s_coreos_v1 driver
  to 'Container Linux'
* Changing a misspelled 'mater' to 'master'
  in swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/swarmmaster.yaml description
* Changing a misspelled 'mater' to 'master' in
  swarm_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/swarmmaster.yaml description

Change-Id: I69a31d2b91fed48f07f649fa876e208e268fb339

subject: Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-10 22:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-10-11 07:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-10-11 13:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 22:12:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
(cherry picked from commit 8377b33bd1e96eda6342d009f85301c5f9acfc03)

commit_message:
Add support for configuring permitted_ethertypes on OVS agent

Neutron recently added support for configuring non-IP ethernet types to
be allowed through firewalls through SECURITYGROUP/permitted_ethertypes.
This adds support for configuring this feature on the ML2/OVS agent.
See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668224 for related neutron change.

Conflicts:
  spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: I9ed539745a705936d9a5110a9cfb05c2f28b0bbb
(cherry picked from commit def07975c604ecc3215fa17dc10fc0ac8fa40545)
(cherry picked from commit 853c5a1568face1b12b115ece4bfbc4253cd67e6)

commit_message:
Retag w/ _arch suffix rhel8 container images

On RHEL we use push containers using podman [1].
Retag task [2] has been skipped due to missing check
for push_containers_podman flag.

[1] https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/zuul.d/tripleoci.yaml#L204
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/blob/master/roles/build-containers/tasks/main.yaml#L187

Change-Id: I74e0913ebfa152ac515e388eb48982790f4f4d90

As I understand it, the spec proposes a way to limit an owner can only access/control nodes he owns, it seems not enough by adding policy to node itself.'}, {'account_id': 7386, 'date': '2019-10-11 13:38:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I think that's definitely something that can be done in the future! This spec only covers node operations, however."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-10-11 14:00:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Thanks for the spec, looks good. Just one question here, do we need
 > to do the same thing to other resources like port? As I understand
 > it, the spec proposes a way to limit an owner can only
 > access/control nodes he owns, it seems not enough by adding policy
 > to node itself.

I'm not sure we would want people with owner implied rights ot be able to change port data, but we would want them to be able to attach/detach vifs, but those paths are under the nodes tree. Those sorts of things are also a bit smaller and I think will be a little more organic too, but a very good point we do need to keep the other areas in mind."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-10-11 14:13:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Expose node owner information to oslo.policy checks

This spec describes a change to the REST API node controller that
allows oslo.policy to make decisions based on whether a user owns
a node.

Change-Id: I1e898f7b9791aa579a733996711945e273ef6a4a
Story: 2006506
Task: 36486
Co-Authored-By: Lars Kellogg-Stedman <lars@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server for rally

The ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server services were missing in the rally
definition. Usually the jobs inherts from our base class which enables
them but rally has a different job parent.

Change-Id: Icd26d2fbdb71480184f3814f07e82025f7ddd963
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7e725331dbaf5845d6a45fa1cf8035d6a61ac744)

commit_message:
metrics_qdr: Changes to target SAF2.0

Metrics Qdr service updates its parameter
set depending on where it is getting installed,
Also the interior nodes are configured to connect to
qdr's running on the server side of SAF.

Depends-On: I195dbf70f490984cedb32d48fe09f4562cbf94fa
Change-Id: I6a3c63979d5c1da548ab65187a0ba7732320f3fa

commit_message:
Fix namespace_tenants misinterpreted as string

Leader-get appears to be converting bool to str
such that "False" is True.

Closes-Bug: #1847769

Change-Id: I03b41810830927a058c87fc8450aafaa2e7da1ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 09:58:06.000000000', 'message': 'Try next manager on sushy iDRAC extension failure

With Redfish, a single system can be managed by more than one
managers. When `idrac-redfish` is trying to set boot device by
calling the OEM extension, it makes sense to fail over the next
manager on failure and retry the same call with it.

The assumption is that underlying OEM extension would fail softly
if it deems the failure as potentially recoverable (with other
manager).

Change-Id: Ic44e5d6a377d7f438eb129a2d8957c9a0ea6f21a
Co-Authored-By: Richard G. Pioso <richard.pioso@dell.com>
Story: 2006570
Task: 36675
'}]
commit_message:
Try next manager on sushy iDRAC extension failure

With Redfish, a single system can be managed by more than one
managers. When `idrac-redfish` is trying to set boot device by
calling the OEM extension, it makes sense to fail over the next
manager on failure and retry the same call with it.

The assumption is that underlying OEM extension would fail softly
if it deems the failure as potentially recoverable (with other
manager).

Change-Id: Ic44e5d6a377d7f438eb129a2d8957c9a0ea6f21a
Co-Authored-By: Richard G. Pioso <richard.pioso@dell.com>
Story: 2006570
Task: 36675

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > Why are we doing this rather than simply returning an empty list?
 > Would that need a microversion?
 > 
 > Yes it would require a microversion to change the response
 > behavior. It's also not specific to down cells scenarios, see
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686517/.

Okay, that's disappointing. Guess there's not much to be done about it so and this is as good as we're going to get"}]

commit_message:
api-guide: Fix available info in handling down cells

Add the 'security_groups' parameter as available infomation
in the "List Servers Detailed" API (GET /servers/detail)
when there is a down cell.

Change-Id: I9653a46478c80b343a5a5f8d6b1607688538b1d5
CLoses-Bug: #1846559

[{'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-10-01 07:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-10-01 07:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-10-01 09:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You can't change the behaviour of CLI options just like this. I also don't understand the issue you are having, can you please create a bug report so that we can see what you are trying to fix?"}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-10-01 09:47:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> You can't change the behaviour of CLI options just like this. I
 > also don't understand the issue you are having, can you please
 > create a bug report so that we can see what you are trying to fix?

https://docs.openstack.org/designate/latest/admin/multiple-pools.html
this page give an example of using designate-management:
designate-manage pool update --file pools.yml --dry_run
but run this command raise:
designate pool update: error: argument --dry_run: expected one argument
I think --dry-run  should be a switch. not key value pair. and users do not know what is behind --dry-run."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-10-01 17:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I do like this change. The current cli is messy. I honestly believed that --delete had to be executed as --delete DELETE for a long time, but turns out any string is valid (e.g. --delete BLA).

Having that said, if we change this, we would at the very least need a release note and a bug report.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-10-01 17:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Ah, I read this patch wrongly earlier, it absolutely does make sense this way. I'm not sure we need a bug report, since we likely can't change the behaviour in stable branches, but add a release note and this one should be fine.

After looking foruther, I even think we should do more updates on this, see my comment below, but that could also be done in a followup."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-10-01 17:53:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
designate-manage pool update --dry-run not should pass argument

--dry-run and --delete should be switchs.
now --dry_run acts as key value pair. users do not know what is behind
--dry-run. and now whatever the value is acceptable. this is unreasonable.

Closes-bug: #1847393

Change-Id: Ia6ab93395deb95173e443f9d3ea77dd52edfcf2c

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I08fe97b5e15d7aae025f3d149c1242841d01ee5b

[{'created': '2019-10-10 16:14:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Manila when run without pacemaker

The supported path is to run the manila-share service
under control of pacemaker using container bundles started
in Step5.  However, it is useful for test and POC purposes
to be able to run the manila-share service without pacemaker
control as a regular container started in Step4.

This change fixes the non-pacemaker deployment path, which runs
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, so that it uses the same
privileges for the manila-share container as are used for the
pacemaker-controlled container-bundle in Step5.

However. we do not change scenario004 to deploy manila using the
non-pacemaker path since in CI we want to test the path that is
supported for customers.

commit_message:
Fix Manila when run without pacemaker

The supported path is to run the manila-share service
under control of pacemaker using container bundles started
in Step5.  However, it is useful for test and POC purposes
to be able to run the manila-share service without pacemaker
control as a regular container started in Step4.

This change fixes the non-pacemaker deployment path, which runs
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, so that it uses the same
privileges for the manila-share container as are used for the
pacemaker-controlled container-bundle in Step5.

However. we do not change scenario004 to deploy manila using the
non-pacemaker path since in CI we want to test the path that is
supported for customers.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705
Related-Bug: #1841941
(cherry picked from commit cff553c7e651aef769ef0ef7f0fc5e9757467cce)
(cherry picked from commit 68a4e125bbd02e7ae5f695045c64201e4a7b5c83)
(cherry picked from commit 24d1d91d8c426f81b5a1ea1e63781b58ae6d9304)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-03 13:20:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix double cert mount in haproxy bundle when using tls everywhere

When deploying with tls-everywhere the haproxy_init_bundle container
will bind mount /etc/ipa/ca.crt twice and starting with podman 1.{3,4}.x
this will break:

  "stderr: Error: /etc/ipa/ca.crt: duplicate mount destination"

The TLS bind mounts are needed in haproxy_init_bundle (which is only
in charge of creating the pcmk resource) because puppet-haproxy uses
a validate command to check the config which will fail if we simply
remove those bind mounts. Instead of skipping this verification with
some parameter/tag, we try and avoid the duplicate cert.

The duplication comes from:
1) https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/containers-common.yaml#L122-L127
2) https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/haproxy/haproxy-pacemaker-puppet.yaml#L263

Since changing it into 1) has large implication, we just avoid
redefining it in 2).

Tested with a full tls-everywhere deploy with the applied patch and the
error is not seen any longer.

Change-Id: I6493fd090c808da01d19cc12d1b8371c67708904
Related-Bug: #1833347
Closes-Bug: #1846495
'}, {'created': '2019-10-03 14:36:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix double cert mount in haproxy bundle when using tls everywhere

When deploying with tls-everywhere the haproxy_init_bundle container
will bind mount /etc/ipa/ca.crt twice and starting with podman 1.{3,4}.x
this will break:

  "stderr: Error: /etc/ipa/ca.crt: duplicate mount destination"

The TLS bind mounts are needed in haproxy_init_bundle (which is only
in charge of creating the pcmk resource) because puppet-haproxy uses
a validate command to check the config which will fail if we simply
remove those bind mounts. Instead of skipping this verification with
some parameter/tag, we try and avoid the duplicate cert by removing the
ca.crt bind mount from deployed_cert_mounts.

The duplication comes from:
1) https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/containers-common.yaml#L122-L127

Since changing it into 1) has large implication, we just avoid
redefining it in 2).

Tested with a full tls-everywhere deploy with the applied patch and the
error is not seen any longer.

Change-Id: I6493fd090c808da01d19cc12d1b8371c67708904
Related-Bug: #1833347
Closes-Bug: #1846495

commit_message:
Fix double cert mount in haproxy bundle when using tls everywhere

When deploying with tls-everywhere the haproxy_init_bundle container
will bind mount /etc/ipa/ca.crt twice and starting with podman 1.{3,4}.x
this will break:

  "stderr: Error: /etc/ipa/ca.crt: duplicate mount destination"

The TLS bind mounts are needed in haproxy_init_bundle (which is only
in charge of creating the pcmk resource) because puppet-haproxy uses
a validate command to check the config which will fail if we simply
remove those bind mounts. Instead of skipping this verification with
some parameter/tag, we try and avoid the duplicate cert by removing the
ca.crt bind mount from deployed_cert_mounts.

The duplication comes from:
1) https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/containers-common.yaml#L122-L127
2) https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/haproxy/haproxy-pacemaker-puppet.yaml#L263

Since changing it into 1) has large implication, we just avoid
redefining it in 2).

Tested with a full tls-everywhere deploy with the applied patch and the
error is not seen any longer.

Change-Id: I6493fd090c808da01d19cc12d1b8371c67708904
Related-Bug: #1833347
Closes-Bug: #1846495

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie5f7c16742468584dcfb1b510d51187dcf341c44

commit_message:
dnm: Poc parallelization using taskflow

Proof of concept to provide parallelization using taskflow. This is
an alternative to the proposed global threadpool approach.

Change-Id: Ic0a1a2b168ed92db8f1eae437ce2cca739eefe16

commit_message:
DNM: Abuse the ThreadPool to build the datamodel

Reuses the audit threadpool to parallelize building the data model.
This proof of concept was used for performance measurements to
demonstrate possible improvements to Watcher.

Change-Id: I1362e5105de2f1309ef5ea3e31d8e97a07810ea6

'}, {'created': '2019-10-11 10:05:13.000000000', 'message': 'Enable ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server for rally

The ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server services were missing in the rally
definition. Usually the jobs inherts from our base class which enables
them but rally has a different job parent.

commit_message:
Enable ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server for rally

The ovs-vswitchd and ovsdb-server services were missing in the rally
definition. Usually the jobs inherts from our base class which enables
them but rally has a different job parent.

Change-Id: Iabe317921d65193e3aaf0071ac1b468511fb6c4c
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

Add release note for ceph-radosgw namespacing

Add release note for new ceph-radosgw tenant namespacing
feature which switches the bucket namespace in a deployment
from global to tenant scoped.

commit_message:
ng-9: Driver for nodegroup operations

This adds the support for creating and deleting worker  nodegroups
using different stack per nodegroup. In order to be backwards
compatible, default nodegroups will remain in one stack.

Having this in mind cluster status is now calculated aggregating the
statuses of the underlying stacks.

Change-Id: I97839ab8495ed5d860785dff1f6e3cc59b6a9ff7
(cherry picked from commit e52f77b299c50f004ee5a875c68d7f129b88a2af)

commit_message:
ng-8: APIs for nodegroup CRUD operations

This adds the changes needed in the API and conductor level to support
creating updating and deleting nodegroups.

Change-Id: I4ad60994ad6b4cb9cac18129557e1e87e61ae98c
(cherry picked from commit 5027e0daf80e07bbdcbc2ab136465c5ef3c155ba)

commit_message:
Enable Ceph Radosgw tenant namespacing

This change enabled automatic tenant namespacing,
which also allows enabling global read permissions
on buckets.

Change-Id: Ic37c7161b7dddad49e3c2ab075d7e8b72f436b35
Closes-Bug: #1833072

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-01 09:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'ng-6: Add new fields to nodegroup objects

Since each nodegroup will be one independent stack, we have to add
more fields to the table and object in order to track each stack
contained in the cluster. This adds the stack_id, version, status,
status_reason and version fields to the nodegroup object.

Change-Id: I6d36b2d3bc6476efbef6a9f702ffc73cfa0fab8c
(cherry picked from commit cbe05aa97d90d3ac38d55fcee472ec2130aa1327)

commit_message:
ng-6: Add new fields to nodegroup objects

Since each nodegroup will be one independent stack, we have to add
more fields to the table and object in order to track each stack
contained in the cluster. This adds the stack_id, version, status,
status_reason and version fields to the nodegroup object.

Change-Id: I6d36b2d3bc6476efbef6a9f702ffc73cfa0fab8c
(cherry picked from commit cbe05aa97d90d3ac38d55fcee472ec2130aa1327)

commit_message:
Fix unit of hw_rng:rate_period

Replace seconds with milliseconds
in the description of hw_rng:rate_period.

* https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsRng

Change-Id: I285f68c81b0587c6a197d4791b09234a1697f5e7
Closes-Bug: #1843542

when we make kubelet.conf file, a variable(${INSTANCE_NAME}) is
currently being used.

however the variable is not defined.
so I make a variable ${INSTANCE_NAME}.

please note that it does not matter whether hostname contains the
following string or not. (".novalocal")
The below command always succeed regardless of the string(".novalocal")

Change-Id: I9c6b80a68b8641a6987c6d6578a6b55aa959a1e1
'}]
commit_message:
make ${INSTANCE_NAME} variable.

when we make kubelet.conf file, a variable(${INSTANCE_NAME}) is
currently being used.

however the variable is not defined.
so I make a variable ${INSTANCE_NAME}.

please note that it does not matter whether hostname contains the
following string or not. (".novalocal")
The below command always succeed regardless of the string(".novalocal")

Change-Id: I9c6b80a68b8641a6987c6d6578a6b55aa959a1e1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2019-09-19 14:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > just soft -1 to make clear something

@zhufl just to clarify tempest doesn't support running on nosetests it has not since . It's actually called out specifically in the docs: https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/overview.html#legacy-run-method (I remember it being more strongly worded). It's been that way since about around the time of the havanna or icehouse release. nostestest stopped working pretty soon after we switched to testr because it wasn't actually a unittest compatible runner, it's dscovery mechanism also ran anything with "test" in the name which meant it ran helper functions as tests and other weird things.

Tempest has historically only ran with a unittest compatible runner, which until python 3.5 (because of unittest2 usage) included runners built on testtools, which includes testtools.run, subunit.run, testrepository, and stestr<2.5.0). The problem here is I think we need to define the support statement in tempest a bit more clearly. Which test runners does tempest support moving forward (and on what python versions). I think the concern with this patch is we're trying to support all the things on all the python versions and that is quite tricky because of testtools (well more specifically unittest2 on python >=3.5).'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2019-09-19 14:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Ah, I finally managed to find my old ML thread about the end of nose support: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/024673.html it was during development of the icehouse release.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-19 17:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-09-20 01:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

Thanks Matthew, seems to support all package versions is a difficult thing:)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-09-20 01:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I agree that we can define the supported test runner for Tempest but python versions limit is little hard for Tempest as it needs to support stable branches etc. 

Anyways that is something we can discuss but we need to get this workaround in for requirement freeze.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-09-20 02:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2019-09-23 12:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I'm fine with landing this in it's current form to unblock g-r. But I think we'll need to follow up here with a few things. What happens if a `self.skipException` is raised inside a test method or a class function? Second how do we handle the case where stestr >=2.5.0 is installed on python >=3.5 but a testtools based runner is used? As zhufl pointed out I don't think we have something to handle the first case, and in the second case this will actively break. Granted that's no better than the current situation in reverse and stestr is more likely to be used so I'm fine with this tradeoff for now."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-10-11 08:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}]

commit_message:
Add workaround to handle the testtool skip exception issue

stestr which is used by Tempest internally to run the test switch
the customize test runner(which use stdlib unittest) for >=py3.5
else testtools.run.- https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/pull/265

These two test runner are not compatible due to skip exception
handling(due to unittest2). testtools.run treat unittestt.SkipTest
as error and stdlib unittest treat unittest2.case.SkipTest raised
by testtools.TestCase.skipException.

testtool issue: https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/272

testtool is not so active now a days and fix is also not decided,
let's add a workaround in Tempest to make it work for both test runner
based on python version same as used by stestr

Tempest should work perfectly with stestr<2.5.0 also which is
also handled in this workaround.

Change-Id: Ie9c013d4d6851d4deef57c1e4c254a9a34374e5a

This patch ensure that if a namespace gets deleted and there is

commit_message:
Avoid race between pod creation retry and namespace deletion

This patch ensure that if a namespace gets deleted and there is
a pending pod creation retry, the later will not fail due to the
subnet being already deleted.

Change-Id: I914109337066441a2750d055aec5cf0e799d7516
Closes-Bug: 1847446
(cherry picked from commit f85866d84da54b6d1bd28c40f046e1039e46a251)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 05:40:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception translation when creating volume

Method `nova.volume.cinder.API#create` accepts `size` as the 3rd args,
but in wrapper of `nova.volume.cinder.translate_volume_exception`, the 3rd
parameter is volume_id. If we hit cinder exception when creating volumes
like the response body down below:
```
{"itemNotFound": {"message": "Volume type with name xxx could not be found.",
"code": 404}}
```
we may get exception in nova compute log like this:
```
BuildAbortException: Build of instance xxx aborted: Volume 40 could not be
found.
```
actually, `40` is volume size, not voluem id.

This could be a little misleading.

Change-Id: If5b0c2f28773e0b2fcb008d5251fb69d950ca569
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-01 15:08:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception translation when creating volume

commit_message:
Fix exception translation when creating volume

Method `nova.volume.cinder.API#create` accepts `size` as the 3rd args,
but in wrapper of `nova.volume.cinder.translate_volume_exception`, the 3rd
parameter is volume_id. If we hit cinder exception when creating volumes
like the response body down below:
```
{"itemNotFound": {"message": "Volume type with name xxx could not be found.",
"code": 404}}
```
we may get exception in nova compute log like this:
```
BuildAbortException: Build of instance xxx aborted: Volume 40 could not be
found.
```
actually, `40` is volume size, not voluem id.

This could be a little misleading.

Closes-Bug: #1846532

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-04 14:25:29.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using virtio1.0-block and virtio1.0-net

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejectedi. We get these returned from libosinfo for newer
operating systems that support virtio1.0. As we want to support
libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request "virtio".
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400
'}, {'created': '2019-07-04 14:30:07.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using virtio1.0-block and virtio1.0-net

correctly rejectedi. We get these returned from libosinfo for newer
operating systems that support virtio1.0. As we want to support
libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request "virtio".
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146

'}, {'created': '2019-07-04 14:32:02.000000000', 'message': 'Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejected by libvirt. We get these returned from libosinfo for
newer operating systems that support virtio1.0.

As we want to support libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request
"virtio", please see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400
'}]
commit_message:
Stop sending bad values from libosinfo to libvirt

When we try to use either virtio1.0-block or virtio1.0-net it is
correctly rejected by libvirt. We get these returned from libosinfo for
newer operating systems that support virtio1.0.

As we want to support libvirts older than 5.2.0, its best we just request
"virtio", please see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsVirtioTransitional

You can see virtio1.0-net and virtio-block being added here:
https://gitlab.com/libosinfo/osinfo-db/blob/master/data/os/fedoraproject.org/fedora-23.xml.in#L31

Change-Id: I633faae47ad5a33b27f5e2eef6e0107f60335146
Closes-Bug: #1835400

commit_message:
Update getting started guide

The getting started guide still references blueprints, which we don't
use any more for tracking feature work, as well as the wiki which we
don't keep up to date. This patch updates the getting started guide so
that new contributors aren't misled about these tools.

Change-Id: Ie0ae2a410b2b65b48c7c97b90d2e372070065dca

commit_message:
Fix wrong interface description

In [1] it response parameters, it is written interface body  string
(Deprecated in v3.2) The geographic location of the service endpoint.
This patch fixes the wrong documentation.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/?expanded=list-endpoints-detail,show-endpoint-details-detail#service-catalog-and-endpoints

Change-Id: I09063dfec1afcd823f5fa190626e8719a202fc28

commit_message:
Fix misleading error msg if swift.conf unreadable

Several tools are returning a misleading error message if swift.conf is
missing or not readable by the user, stating that the hash pre-/suffixes
are missing. Let's fix this by catching the real issue down below.

Change-Id: I7a47e6260ed51a3b7d9665b3a4510520429ae158

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: If114f0fc25c68e20160ab809479536cc83756695
Sem-Ver: feature

Updated operator guide documentation for
1. segregated sections appropriately
2. referred masakariclient for CLI section
3. added detailed 'Install and configure for Ubuntu' section
4. added detailed 'Verify operation' section
5. used sphinx-build instead of the pbr sphinx extention for building docs
   as instructed by the PTI[1]
6. cleaned up build_sphinx related entries in setup.cfg

commit_message:
Reorganize masakari documentation

Updated operator guide documentation for
1. segregated sections appropriately
2. referred masakariclient for CLI section
3. added detailed 'Install and configure for Ubuntu' section
4. added detailed 'Verify operation' section
5. used sphinx-build instead of the pbr sphinx extention for building docs
   as instructed by the PTI[1]
6. cleaned up build_sphinx related entries in setup.cfg

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#documentation

Change-Id: Iec93bebdbc7ffe1ccd27bb11f474384ff06a559c

commit_message:
add python LOG when deleting raw template file which is not found.

when deleting not existing raw template file, the function(raw_template_delete) does
not raise error.
so in order to easily detect the situation, leave a LOG.

[{'created': '2019-10-11 01:50:51.000000000', 'message': 'Use crm_mon for pacemaker-remote deployments

As described in bug #1728527 cibadmin does not expose the state of
the pacemaker-remote nodes which means hostmonitor cannot track
them. This change switches to use crm_mon to check the status of
remote nodes if the new config option host.restrict_to_remotes
to set to True. This will trigger host monitor to use crm_mon
to monitor nodes and will only monitor nodes that are marked
as remotes (not members).

Change-Id: I3f2026805413504c875ea5f39eb036d44b26dd43
Depends-On: Iaa2251708616e9c69817bf5b346d795ea7a4d21b

commit_message:
Use crm_mon for pacemaker-remote deployments

As described in bug #1728527 cibadmin does not expose the state of
the pacemaker-remote nodes which means hostmonitor cannot track
them. This change switches to use crm_mon to check the status of
remote nodes if the new config option host.restrict_to_remotes
to set to True. This will trigger host monitor to use crm_mon
to monitor nodes and will only monitor nodes that are marked
as remotes (not members).

Change-Id: I3f2026805413504c875ea5f39eb036d44b26dd43
Depends-On: Iaa2251708616e9c69817bf5b346d795ea7a4d21b
Closes-Bug: #1728527
(cherry picked from commit dc9b77772417c99368a4bbe243bb8e0e7c0bca47)

commit_message:
Allow cluster config for any cluster state

Similar to what the certificates api does, it doesn't make sense to
disallow cluster config.

task: 36891

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 14:02:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix properties in glance_image provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Similar to I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"foo='bar'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'foo': u'bar'}"
or
...,"{'foo': 'bar'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the glance_image provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I1829c7e59058fa72690dc08b3e2f65afcad7ea46
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 16:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix properties in glance_image provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Similar to I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"foo='bar'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'foo': u'bar'}"
or
...,"{'foo': 'bar'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the glance_image provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I1829c7e59058fa72690dc08b3e2f65afcad7ea46
'}]
commit_message:
Fix properties in glance_image provider for osc >= 4.0.0

Similar to I6a68505d15473b140c85a199a09d2fee45864800

Openstackclient 4.0.0 changed the way some properties are displayed
on screen.

Old:
...,"Properties"
...,"foo='bar'"

New:
...,"Properties"
...,"{u'foo': u'bar'}"
or
...,"{'foo': 'bar'}"

This is breaking idempotency on the glance_image provider, since it
does not detect them correctly. This patch aims at fixing this, by
trying to detect the new format, and using JSON parsing in that case.

Change-Id: I1829c7e59058fa72690dc08b3e2f65afcad7ea46

commit_message:
grub configuration should use user kernel & ramdisk

compared with pxe_config.template, ramdisk boot with grub should use
aki_path and ari_path

Change-Id: Ibedf375cfeeb20917f06e52b1e86a6990a3c494b
Story: 2006639
Task: 36855
(cherry picked from commit 2364c8b247899f8ac9fb42b53a070db2ea50a2e0)

[{'account_id': 29014, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:39:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20284, 'date': '2018-10-22 10:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add MacroSAN cinder driver

This driver supports below features:
* Volume Create/Delete
* Volume Attach/Detach
* Snapshot Create/Delete
* Create Volume from Snapshot
* Copy Image to Volume
* Copy Volume to Image
* Clone Volume
* Extend volume
* Volume Migration

This patchset includes the unit tests.

Implements: blueprint macrosan-cinder-driver

Change-Id: I4c41f4e029103db4514762c50b21c50619edf5a6

commit_message:
Use crm_mon for pacemaker-remote deployments

As described in bug #1728527 cibadmin does not expose the state of
the pacemaker-remote nodes which means hostmonitor cannot track
them. This change switches to use crm_mon to check the status of
remote nodes if the new config option host.restrict_to_remotes
to set to True. This will trigger host monitor to use crm_mon
to monitor nodes and will only monitor nodes that are marked
as remotes (not members).

Change-Id: I3f2026805413504c875ea5f39eb036d44b26dd43
Depends-On: Iaa2251708616e9c69817bf5b346d795ea7a4d21b
Closes-Bug: #1728527

commit_message:
Check NetApp SnapRestore license for pools

Added check to validate SnapRestore license for
NetApp ONTAP pools before setting revert_to_snapshot_support
to true/false for the respective pool.
This was always set to True before.

Change-Id: I4750d28c8acfe6d68a91e129e767c6e8607e6a75
Closes-Bug: #1678524
(cherry picked from commit f333b88e2521c8a1fecb88206cfb08046957346f)
(cherry picked from commit 9e39a138fbe8c0546898543de8c007238caf0ef0)
(cherry picked from commit 62996ad8f663e45758227b927058d80bab3758df)

[{'created': '2019-10-04 17:23:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicated msec

asctime includes the msec in the time. If we include msecs this ends up
displaying "2019-09-27 00:46:18,344.344" which is wrong

Change-Id: I9ca066b06b5ac85272202430713edb8cee37a620
(cherry picked from commit 003be5f5ec50eed24d231879a3fbaa407d7f149b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicated msec

asctime includes the msec in the time. If we include msecs this ends up
displaying "2019-09-27 00:46:18,344.344" which is wrong

Change-Id: I9ca066b06b5ac85272202430713edb8cee37a620
(cherry picked from commit 003be5f5ec50eed24d231879a3fbaa407d7f149b)

Migrate building IPA to ironic-python-agent-builder

We're switching the building process to a new project that is governed
and supported by the ironic team.
