commit_message:
Add environments dcn.yaml and dcn-hci.yaml.

Adds 2 new DCN related environments created using the
sample-env-generator.

Also updates a comment for the NovaComputeAvailabilityZone parameter in
deployment/nova/nova-az-config.yaml.

Change-Id: Iad5c932a1f469130bcf9d82277eac4fcf7ecda75

commit_message:
PDF documentation build

- Add 'pdf-docs' tox env
- Skip sample configuration files in PDF doc due to LaTeX error
- Specify openany in extraclassoptions to skip blank pages
  (oneside is also specified to use the same page layout
   for even and odd pages)
- tocdepth is set to 2 for better PDF TOC
- printindex and makeindex are set to empty in latex_elements
  to avoid an empty "Index" section in PDF

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Story: 2006082
Task: 34848
Change-Id: I738ea91a0b519c2ae0692dfc81e02d5069042ea6

commit_message:
Remove sensu-client service

Sensu client has been deprecated and it's functionality substituted
by collectd-sensubility. This patch removes sensu-client composable
service

Change-Id: I4be68eb7319b2c92cc7d0fc9df7a5c87dfb5106c

commit_message:
Remove Tacker service

The Tacker service has been incomplete since Queens. They restructured
the services and TripleO has never implemented code to handle this new
structure. Since it's been disabled since Queens and there is currently
no plans to fix it, let's remove the service code.

Change-Id: I2856e894b58d50c2d3484ccd02bfb1d43625847f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682457/
Related-Bug: #1714270

commit_message:
Cleanup override file

This change organizes the override template file into
header/packages/footer related sections and alphabetizes each of these.

Change-Id: I96734bf9381a5cff0b9af4aed6a25b9b2da412b6

commit_message:
Remove ContainerCLI from ovb-ha default file

Don't override ContainerCLI in ovb-ha file, use it from other
templates like docker.yaml or podman.yaml

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674866
Change-Id: I87067bda96d09f862b0ed13f05232490328b1921
(cherry picked from commit 3b51d705b96960ddb4248bc8747efd9aced46e25)

network was lost if subnets were added or removed from that network.

Closes-Bug: #1843485
Co-authored-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not lose router logical port upon subnet add on the external net

Prior to this patch, logical port used by the router to the external
network was lost if subnet was added to that network. That was
caused by missing explicit delete call in DelLRouterPortCommand.

Also added functional test to exercise this particular code path:
  test_router::test_gateway_chassis_with_subnet_changes()

Closes-Bug: #1843485
Co-authored-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <flaviof@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I3e9d62ffc5eab396e983c0769e53d2d1f35644f6

commit_message:
Update config to support RHEL/CENT8

This change updates our bindep configurations and local test runner
to ensure it works with RHEL/CENT8.

Change-Id: I5585fa8b6e2094132596073e6c441267a18aea90
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-10-08 15:41:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern" errors

The current code that matches the LIBVIRTD_ARGS= lines can have multiple
matches if said line shows up multiple times in a comment and we can end
up with the following error:

  Error: /Stage[main]/Nova::Migration::Libvirt/File_line[/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd libvirtd args]/
    ensure: change from 'absent' to 'present' failed: More than one line in file '/etc/sysconfig/libvirtd' matches pattern
      'LIBVIRTD_ARGS='

For the record the sysconfig file that triggered this error had the
following lines:

  # connects.
  LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--timeout 120"

  # If systemd socket activation is disabled, then the following
  # can be used to listen on TCP/TLS sockets
  #LIBVIRTD_ARGS="--listen"

Tested this change and I correctly did not fail the deployment anymore.

Change-Id: Iae595796559cc6551d8ae27e2573122a8a2da15d
Closes-Bug: #1847288

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 20:20:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
(cherry picked from commit e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41)
(cherry picked from commit 57b127459189e39e993426f8e401e288f6394d4b)
(cherry picked from commit 9e5d33ac244e8dce31ff6d2c7119ee4bd53a9908)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
(cherry picked from commit e78b220f448c7eb0de35aafd1d49b00547384d41)
(cherry picked from commit 57b127459189e39e993426f8e401e288f6394d4b)
(cherry picked from commit 9e5d33ac244e8dce31ff6d2c7119ee4bd53a9908)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I4dc98dee7881090ca60359379d5bc76e99847256
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2019-10-03 15:28:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update driver section.

Most of the operations are common to the drivers we support.
For example, all drivers support device discovery, VM
creation/deletion, etc. None of them support firmware/shell
update.

Also, we need to include the supported product families and

commit_message:
Update driver section.

Apart from FPGA and GPU, we support other device types
today and will add more in the future.

Most of the operations are common to the drivers we support.
For example, all drivers support device discovery, VM
creation/deletion, etc. None of them support firmware/shell
update today.

Also, we need to include the supported product families and
any special notes for the driver.

So this update removes the per-device-type files for FPGA
and GPU, and instead adds per-driver notes.

Change-Id: Ic0836e5a8d470a0f185d8d73e4f9ae21dfa63e45

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 15:12:12.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate Puppet 5 support

Puppet 5 will only recieve fixes and security
updates to May 2020 [1]. See quote [2].

Since we support Puppet 6 already this is not
an issue. The Ussuri release will be around
the 2020-05-13 date [3] which will be almost
the same time as the Puppet 5 EOL.

With this we let users know that they can use
Puppet 5 in Ussuri but that we stop officially
supporting it in V.

My hope is that we could also make this a hard
requirement in V so that we can start using the
features that are >= 6.0.0 only.

[1] https://puppet.com/misc/puppet-enterprise-lifecycle
[2] "For example, the PE2018.1 LTS uses Puppet Agent 5.5, so the open
source Puppet Agent 5.5 will receive bug fix and security updates until
May 2020."
[3] https://releases.openstack.org/ussuri/index.html

Change-Id: I233ba3db5127d2e9a4c08c767474ac038305d488

commit_message:
Deprecate Puppet 5 support

Puppet 5 will only recieve fixes and security
updates to May 2020 [1]. See quote [2].

Since we support Puppet 6 already this is not
an issue. The Ussuri release will be around
the 2020-05-13 date [3] which will be almost
the same time as the Puppet 5 EOL.

With this we let users know that they can use
Puppet 5 in Ussuri but that we stop officially
supporting it in V.

My hope is that we could also make this a hard
requirement in V so that we can start using the
features that are >= 6.0.0 only.

[1] https://puppet.com/misc/puppet-enterprise-lifecycle
[2] "For example, the PE2018.1 LTS uses Puppet Agent 5.5, so the open
source Puppet Agent 5.5 will receive bug fix and security updates until
May 2020."
[3] https://releases.openstack.org/ussuri/index.html

Change-Id: I233ba3db5127d2e9a4c08c767474ac038305d488

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic164179e383ecefb5201805c1b26e1ffa66c4a80

commit_message:
Release trove RC2 for Train

This release is being proposed to pick up translations and bugfixes
that have merged to stable/train but not been released.

Not all changes are critical to make it into the initial Train
coordinated release and can wait until a stable release later. If
this patch does not get an ack from the PTL and/or release liaison
by EOD Thursday it will just be abandoned.

Teams may also choose to -1 this patch and update it once any final
commits merge prior to the October 10 deadline.

Change-Id: Ib355466077e0c8166db09e69fdb3951755104173

subject: Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event
messages: [{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-10 12:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-10 12:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-10 12:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-10 17:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 12:29:18.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event

In case of a kuryr-controller restart, if the namespace deletion
event was already executed and it is retriggered, it can make the
kuryr-controller fail as the kuryrnet CRD would have been already
deleted and we cannot obtain the subnet id from it. In that case
the event just need to be skip.

Change-Id: I14fcf820d94319541dd7bf13893e82cf0373969c
Closes-Bug: 1847453
(cherry picked from commit efae1f5211e3907ff58853155b785f0e8fb34e9b)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event

In case of a kuryr-controller restart, if the namespace deletion
event was already executed and it is retriggered, it can make the
kuryr-controller fail as the kuryrnet CRD would have been already
deleted and we cannot obtain the subnet id from it. In that case
the event just need to be skip.

Change-Id: I14fcf820d94319541dd7bf13893e82cf0373969c
Closes-Bug: 1847453
(cherry picked from commit efae1f5211e3907ff58853155b785f0e8fb34e9b)

'}]
commit_message:
Fix code-block JSON format issues

Sphinx 2.0 is more strict on enforcing proper format for the specified
code type. This resulted in a few warnings due to JSON code blocks not
being valid JSON. This cleans up a few cases that were not properly
formatted.

Closes-bug: #1822891

Change-Id: Id6fa50b759add5d2286b98f1752a7ff92bf0515d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e27d781455c649fe9349bf408b74292e81e2b4ec)

commit_message:
Add --platform support when uploading images

Adding --platform when uploading images will set a tripleo_platform
image meta data property and prefix all images with the platform (and
arch) to make them stand out in an openstack image list.

Support is added in such a way that that image names are not altered if
no --platform is specified.  As platform really only makes sense
*within* and architecture we ensure that both options are supplied.

Conflicts:
    lower-constraints.txt: Due to not existing in stable/queens
    test-requirements.txt: Due to request-mock specification
                            difference on queens
    tripleoclient/utils.py: Due to the following not existing on stable/queens
                            Ie4b7951147f5a1aec654982e21296a749fdd865c
                            I61763f62c5d44f098ad60f9426871caef16cd6de

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ia56d22b244cfa5dddb5d110b54a525dfd80a7aaf
(cherry picked from commit 3e786fe8329914e9a3f03de72f50d9fd2d318fc6)

commit_message:
Allow platform in instackenv.json

We'll store that as /extra/tripleo_platform so we can later refer to it.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Id82de41e7a49c2d8124fc74125ed51031579aa80
(cherry picked from commit 89cefb9ef4d09a867931dbadb37362b6c6adb436)

Adding --architecture when uploading images will set a hw_architecture image
meta data property and prefix all images with the arch to make them

While tripleo doesn't yet take advantage of using the image meta data

commit_message:
Add --architecture support when uploading images

Adding --architecture when uploading images will set a hw_architecture image
meta data property and prefix all images with the arch to make them
stand out in an openstack image list

While tripleo doesn't yet take advantage of using the image meta data
it's still helpful for manual testing to ensure that image selection
implies appropriate hardware.

Support is added in such a way that that image names are not altered if
no --architecture is specified.

Conflicts:
tripleoclient/utils.py: Due to the following not existing on stable/queens
                        Ie4b7951147f5a1aec654982e21296a749fdd865c
                        I61763f62c5d44f098ad60f9426871caef16cd6de
                        I340be11bc9471df22f038629679634c3542d34d6

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I352759014ce4c249d8391b03317012000221f96f
(cherry picked from commit b5500956d30a738b442ed0b9894a94552dfd7d09)

commit_message:
New class nova::metadata::novajoin::policy

This allows novajoin policy overrides to be written to
/etc/novajoin/policy.json, just as nova::policy does for
/etc/nova/policy.json.

Change-Id: I8b2b60164314ce92b0df1a648f1356290576047a
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Always define properties for image even if empty

This re-factor allows us to set default properties very simply.  It does
add empty properties on images that otherwise didn't have them but this
should be safe[1]

[1] famous last words

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I136ae6c59bb4a4b3e12eb6a96bfbce732554bb4c
(cherry picked from commit 8d05757bcf70ded15dfa5dc073caaf0409a50383)

commit_message:
Introduce trivial helpers to manage image_files and names

This is a trivial re-factor but subsequent patches will increase
complexity of these helpers without clogging up callers with this logic.

Conflicts:
lower-constraints.txt: Due to not existing in stable/queens
test-requirements.txt: Due to request-mock specification
                        difference on queens
tripleoclient/utils.py: Due to the following not existing on stable/queens
                        Ie4b7951147f5a1aec654982e21296a749fdd865c
                        I61763f62c5d44f098ad60f9426871caef16cd6de
                        I340be11bc9471df22f038629679634c3542d34d6

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: If9b115880e9755f2753a2e53a5869e12a17722a3
(cherry picked from commit 9db478bf0fe1e2b05b681ec4fcd8a0934feec3d1)

commit_message:
Release manila-tempest-plugin 0.4.1

New bug-fixes have been committed since the train
release of manila-tempest-plugin 0.4.0. While this
comes from a branch-less project, using
manila-tempest-plugin 0.4.0 to test older branches
of manila will require workarounds, especially to
avoid false negative test failures.

Change-Id: I7aca29250ffabc6d03507b012104d38289f139db

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 13:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic95585f33945138cb0ec1b24e41d09d3f6046893
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic95585f33945138cb0ec1b24e41d09d3f6046893

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal Nóbrega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23078, 'name': 'Jeremy Freudberg', 'email': 'jeremyfreudberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'jeremyfreudberg'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-09 15:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-09 15:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Uhm, Jeremy, can you please manage to ping Tony later, so that we can merge https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686732/ and include it here? (and maybe also the sahara.git change)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-09 15:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Waiting for final patches to land. Please update this with the new commit hash when ready. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-10 14:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like referenced patch landed. Are you ready to update the commit hash and get this through? Or are there other important patches in flight?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jeremy, I'm going to amend the patch to include the cdh change. If you want to merge the grenade patches, I think that they are clear enough that we can get just one +2 (also because Telles is not around). If you manage to merge it, please change this review to include that patch as well (or propose a new patch - I will be offline for a few hours).

Sean, thanks for the patience!"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

this can be merged.

i will propose another patch here after https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687163/ merges (dependent on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687696/ and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687693/ )'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> this can be merged.
 > 
 > i will propose another patch here after https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687163/
 > merges (dependent on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687696/ and
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687693/ )

If you would be looking at an RC3 release yet today, we might as well just wait. We don't want to do RCs if no one is going to get a chance to pick them up."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:45:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

ok, let's wait (just a couple hours), good point"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:46:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> ok, let's wait (just a couple hours), good point

We'll hold the train for you. ;)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-10 19:44:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Looks like the last patch is just waiting on a non-voting patch to land. Anything needed with these plugins after that, or was it just a matter of making sure sahara changes didn't break anything with the plugins?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-10 19:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-10 19:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That should be it :) now we are more python3-happy.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-10 20:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

and thanks again for the patience'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-10-10 20:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

wow... luigi is faster than me... had literally typed "git revie" when i got the notification
to answer Sean's question: no, we don't need any rc3. just that sahara patch which luigi just put. this is good to go.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-10 20:16:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, I was just confused. Looks like we could have processed the plugin releases earlier as sahara could just be done by itself. But now we have them all, so good that it's all covered."}]

commit_message:
Release sahara and sahara-plugin-* RC2 for Train

This release is being proposed to pick up translations and bugfixes
that have merged to stable/train but not been released.

Not all changes are critical to make it into the initial Train
coordinated release and can wait until a stable release later. If
this patch does not get an ack from the PTL and/or release liaison
by EOD Thursday it will just be abandoned.

Teams may also choose to -1 this patch and update it once any final
commits merge prior to the October 10 deadline.

commit_message:
Bump diskimage-builder minimum to 2.24.0

There was a bug[1] in diskimage-builder when using pypi mirrors
if the host doesn't have "python" available DIB will fail.
So, I am going to bump the requirements minimum in Octavia for
diskimage-builder to be the minimum version with this fix.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1577105

Change-Id: If0ff2a855ad5b9d9ef3742ad0596c97a6dbf81ed
(cherry picked from commit 1aeb416a7e72dad298acb7f11ad54eabfd9ea49e)

commit_message:
Add posibilities to configure OVNNorthboundServerPort in split stacks

This changes is need by split stacks when ovn dbs are not colocated
with neutron-server to configure correctly OVNNorthboundServerPort.
When neutron api is deployed with ovn dbs on the same node,
ovn dbs template set this port. But in other cases when
they are not colocated we need to set this port in neutron
plugin template.

Change-Id: Ic84cc8864c799eaa4273c022b07445ec997a7fc9
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Unmount NetApp active share after replica promote

The NetApp cDOT driver is now fixed to unmount the original
active share volume after one of its replica gets promoted.

Change-Id: Iecb734b431f0b7bc9a905b0a672013869ff60fd8
Closes-Bug: #1634278
(cherry picked from commit 8fd4dfb4dea54706ab8261e342b249a430f8613d)

commit_message:
PDF Documentation Build tox target

This patch adds a `pdf-docs` tox target that will build
PDF versions of our docs. As per the Train community goal:

  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Add sphinxcontrib-svg2pdfconverter to doc/requirements.txt
to convert our SVGs.

Story: 2006105

Change-Id: Ia0599ac65cc324e317430495a879f52c76f72484
Signed-off-by: Alexandra Settle <asettle@suse.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic286dab36fd08bd313543fb3748d8ba6fb3e5186

subject: grenade: start from stein, disable heat integration tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 22:54:39.000000000', 'message': 'grenade: start from stein, disable heat integration tests

- set the starting point as stein and the destination to train
  (to be adapted in the backports of this patch);
- heat tests should have been disabled already here;
  they are really flaky, they takes more time and they should be
  tested by heat.

Change-Id: I5571ac5e578f98465737373598b358aa7dab93e0
(cherry picked from commit 810d94bfbb1ffa0c68949c3180dadfab333fb4cd)
'}]
commit_message:
grenade: start from stein, disable heat integration tests

- set the starting point as stein and the destination to train
  (to be adapted in the backports of this patch);
- heat tests should have been disabled already here;
  they are really flaky, they takes more time and they should be
  tested by heat.

Change-Id: I5571ac5e578f98465737373598b358aa7dab93e0
(cherry picked from commit 810d94bfbb1ffa0c68949c3180dadfab333fb4cd)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I8f48edb857ba4e9c7a91745a3d4c9b0d962f40c3
Sem-Ver: feature

related variables would be empty or undefined and need to be handled

is a non-trivial backport of I361c90e438e79e180e2a745da82e619347fed13e.

commit_message:
Handle empty cert related hostvar info

When certificates are neither generated nor provided (e.g. on update)
related variables would be empty or undefined and need to be handled
accordingly.

Note: this file has been relocated to triple-ansible in train+ so this
is a non-trivial backport of I361c90e438e79e180e2a745da82e619347fed13e.

Change-Id: I6afe5078bd285374b3a9311a066ba10883c2ff66
Closes-Bug: #1845366

commit_message:
DNM: Test openstackdocstheme PDF support

It seems latex_elements from openstackdocstheme does not work
as expected. After latex_elements is configured in doc/source/conf.py
in the project repo, PDF file with OpenStack logo will be generated.

Change-Id: Id8e122dbfd6512904c218e21823971b3334327aa

commit_message:
Create segment container w/ same policy as primary

When users upload an MPU object, s3api will automatically
create a segment container if one doesn't already exist.

Currently, s3api will create the segment bucket using the
cluster's default storage policy. This patch changes that
behavior to use the same storage policy as the primary bucket.

Change-Id: Ib64a06868bd3670a1d4a1860ac29122e1ede7c39
Closes-Bug: 1832390

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 20:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add scenario test for port forwarding and UDP

This test extends exisiting port_forwarding scenario test which
was only configuring and testing port forwarding to 2 different
servers using TCP protocol (by SSH to those instances to different
ports).

Now it also creates UDP port forwarding, spawns nc on each VM
and tries to connect to this nc and check if it will return proper
message from each VM.

commit_message:
Add scenario test for port forwarding and UDP

This test extends exisiting port_forwarding scenario test which
was only configuring and testing port forwarding to 2 different
servers using TCP protocol (by SSH to those instances to different
ports).

Now it also creates UDP port forwarding, spawns nc on each VM
and tries to connect to this nc and check if it will return proper
message from each VM.

Change-Id: I3afd877521e7cf66a8970f531111b3e1b1e7b150

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-30 19:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Modify DVR flows to allow ARP requests to hit ARP Responder table

DVR does the ARP table update through the control plane, and does not
allow any ARP requests to get out of the node.

In order to address the allowed address pair VRRP IP issue with DVR,
we need to add an ARP entry into the ARP Responder table for the
allowed address pair IP ( which is taken care by the patch in [1])

This patch adds a rule in the br-int to redirect the packet
destinated to the router to the actual router-port and also moves
the arp filtering rule to the tunnel or the physical port based on the
configuration.

By adding the above rule it allows the ARP requests to reach the
ARP Responder table and filters the ARP requests before it reaches
the physical network or the tunnel.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601336/
Related-Bug: #1774459

Change-Id: I3905ea56ca0ff35bdd96c818719e6d63a3eb5a72
(cherry picked from commit 52b537ca22b2d7d81a84b2f75de577d8dffee94c)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Modify DVR flows to allow ARP requests to hit ARP Responder table

DVR does the ARP table update through the control plane, and does not
allow any ARP requests to get out of the node.

In order to address the allowed address pair VRRP IP issue with DVR,
we need to add an ARP entry into the ARP Responder table for the
allowed address pair IP ( which is taken care by the patch in [1])

This patch adds a rule in the br-int to redirect the packet
destinated to the router to the actual router-port and also moves
the arp filtering rule to the tunnel or the physical port based on the
configuration.

By adding the above rule it allows the ARP requests to reach the
ARP Responder table and filters the ARP requests before it reaches
the physical network or the tunnel.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601336/
Related-Bug: #1774459

Change-Id: I3905ea56ca0ff35bdd96c818719e6d63a3eb5a72
(cherry picked from commit 52b537ca22b2d7d81a84b2f75de577d8dffee94c)

commit_message:
Create multiple phases to upgrade Barbican database

Currenlty, there is only one phase for Barbican
upgrading database. It is not suitable for Rolling
upgrade feature.

We need to split two phases:
- Expand phase is to add columns or tables to database.
- Contract phase is delete columns or tables.

Partial-Implements: blueprint rolling-upgrade
Change-Id: Idf191d79ce7794bbb5238bfed3218c416ceaf9b9

commit_message:
grenade: start from train, disable heat integration tests

- set the starting point as train (to be adapted in the
  backports of this patch);
- heat tests should have been disabled already here;
  they are really flaky, they takes more time and they should be
  tested by heat.

Change-Id: I5571ac5e578f98465737373598b358aa7dab93e0

commit_message:
Check NetApp SnapRestore license for pools

Added check to validate SnapRestore license for
NetApp ONTAP pools before setting revert_to_snapshot_support
to true/false for the respective pool.
This was always set to True before.

Change-Id: I4750d28c8acfe6d68a91e129e767c6e8607e6a75
Closes-Bug: #1678524
(cherry picked from commit f333b88e2521c8a1fecb88206cfb08046957346f)
(cherry picked from commit 9e39a138fbe8c0546898543de8c007238caf0ef0)

commit_message:
Release puppet-designate 15.5.0 for Train

We need to release 15.5.0 instead of 15.4.0
for Train because we had broken code in that
release since Designate has removed the
pool-manager [1].

We fixed our testing in [2] and deprecated
that code and added a release note in [3].

See the release patch that updates the
metadata [4] which holds the complete
patch chain.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/train.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687247/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687333/
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687334

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687334
Change-Id: I72ddf92837bfd99beb4279afabf57bb84c7792fe

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-01 16:35:26.000000000', 'message': "Remove the check which causes plugin's quotas update failure

The check causes external plugin's quotas fields unknown
exception because the quotas fields are not part of
QUOTA_FIELDS which only includes the fields for
cinder, neutron and nova.

Meanwhile the exception message throws TypeError.

This commit removes the uncessary check. It also helps
fix the manila-ui's bug #1842119

Change-Id: If093f4ecf1e344792b347c5c338b441b1ab42a04
Closes-bug: #1798048
Closes-bug: #1842119
(cherry picked from commit 44987f02be671fd81b3dcd8d22f9fa1b219488c2)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the check which causes plugin's quotas update failure

The check causes external plugin's quotas fields unknown
exception because the quotas fields are not part of
QUOTA_FIELDS which only includes the fields for
cinder, neutron and nova.

Meanwhile the exception message throws TypeError.

This commit removes the uncessary check. It also helps
fix the manila-ui's bug #1842119

Change-Id: If093f4ecf1e344792b347c5c338b441b1ab42a04
Closes-bug: #1798048
Closes-bug: #1842119

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3749f6ef9215ed27d8571ac44a7dd029381d3813

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 21:03:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Manila when run without pacemaker

The supported path is to run the manila-share service
under control of pacemaker using container bundles started
in Step5.  However, it is useful for test and POC purposes
to be able to run the manila-share service without pacemaker
control as a regular container started in Step4.

This change fixes the non-pacemaker deployment path, which runs
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, so that it uses the same
privileges for the manila-share container as are used for the
pacemaker-controlled container-bundle in Step5.

However. we do not change scenario004 to deploy manila using the
non-pacemaker path since in CI we want to test the path that is
supported for customers.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705
Related-Bug: #1841941
(cherry picked from commit cff553c7e651aef769ef0ef7f0fc5e9757467cce)
(cherry picked from commit 68a4e125bbd02e7ae5f695045c64201e4a7b5c83)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Manila when run without pacemaker

The supported path is to run the manila-share service
under control of pacemaker using container bundles started
in Step5.  However, it is useful for test and POC purposes
to be able to run the manila-share service without pacemaker
control as a regular container started in Step4.

This change fixes the non-pacemaker deployment path, which runs
manila-share in Step4 rather than Step5, so that it uses the same
privileges for the manila-share container as are used for the
pacemaker-controlled container-bundle in Step5.

However. we do not change scenario004 to deploy manila using the
non-pacemaker path since in CI we want to test the path that is
supported for customers.

Change-Id: I8effea96a4428281b5a5dfa9711bb602fdbdc705
Related-Bug: #1841941
(cherry picked from commit cff553c7e651aef769ef0ef7f0fc5e9757467cce)
(cherry picked from commit 68a4e125bbd02e7ae5f695045c64201e4a7b5c83)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 15:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Remove all old pcmklatest images

An operator may make a mistake when importing images, resulting
in more than one image being present. This may happen, for example,
if an image is imported from one source, then another.

To ensure that all old images are deleted, and to prevent a failure
in the command executing the deletion if there is more than one
result when listing the images, we process the deletion in a loop
per stdout line.

Change-Id: I67e0a321fe2c77e54966cd9b70be56a489dd2007
Closes: rhbz#1727173
'}]
commit_message:
Remove all old pcmklatest images

An operator may make a mistake when importing images, resulting
in more than one image being present. This may happen, for example,
if an image is imported from one source, then another.

To ensure that all old images are deleted, and to prevent a failure
in the command executing the deletion if there is more than one
result when listing the images, we process the deletion in a loop
per stdout line.

Change-Id: I67e0a321fe2c77e54966cd9b70be56a489dd2007
Closes: rhbz#1727173

commit_message:
use callback payloads for AGENT OVS_RESTARTED events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for AGENT OVS_RESTARTED events. In addition it updates the unit tests to
also use payloads for OVS_RESTARTED based events as needed.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636421/
Change-Id: I35c00d1e25e3c8abc4027219b0b3b3d34a480339

commit_message:
Allow using registry authentication to pull ceph related containers

Ceph ansible now supports authenticated registry and allows users to
pass and process the required parameters (username/password) when the
CephAuthRegistry boolean is true.
This review reflects this change in tripleo adding these new parameters
and pass them to ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I931fe0cb4209e0859e3918f3365e0354dddb30eb

commit_message:
Drop os-testr test-requirement and pretty_tox.sh

os-testr is only needed to provide the "subunit-trace" command which
is used in the tools/pretty_tox.sh script. And pretty_tox.sh is not
needed. "stestr" can be used directly in tox.ini. So drop
tools/pretty_tox.sh .

Change-Id: I6a18183f092689c8c9d283c19914da9baa59cc32

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-27 18:16:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add Python3 project templates for Ussuri release

Following the process set down in the TC resolution on updating Python
versions:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html

this change adds the Zuul template for Python 3 unit test jobs in the
Ussuri release. The selected python versions are the same as for the
Train cycle:

* The latest released version of Python that is available for testing is
  3.7.
* The only version of Python 3 that is the default in the
  distributions listed in the PTI (CentOS 8, Ubuntu 18.04 Bionic, openSUSE
  Leap 15) is Python 3.6.

Change-Id: Idcffc5fd786db65ca4edbee03d2f9d45e0026639
'}]
commit_message:
Add Python3 project templates for Ussuri release

Following the process set down in the TC resolution on updating Python
versions:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html

this change adds the Zuul template for Python 3 unit test jobs in the
Ussuri release. The selected python versions are the same as for the
Train cycle:

* The latest released version of Python that is available for testing is
  3.7.
* The only version of Python 3 that is the default in the
  distributions listed in the PTI (CentOS 8, Ubuntu 18.04 Bionic, openSUSE
  Leap 15) is Python 3.6.

Change-Id: Idcffc5fd786db65ca4edbee03d2f9d45e0026639

[{'created': '2019-10-09 09:00:14.000000000', 'message': "ironic-tempest-functional-python3 unused variables

The difference between the jobs `ironic-tempest-functional-python2`
and `ironic-tempest-functional-python3` should be only the python
version in use (for deployment and to run the functional tests).

Removing the variables `IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE` and
`IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK`doesn't matter for the functional tests,
and they are set with different values in the python2 job.

Change-Id: I49ff241793f42de0f0cc9d98ae1f99940e581dcb
"}]
commit_message:
ironic-tempest-functional-python3 unused variables

The difference between the jobs `ironic-tempest-functional-python2`
and `ironic-tempest-functional-python3` should be only the python
version in use (for deployment and to run the functional tests).

Removing the variables `IRONIC_TEMPEST_WHOLE_DISK_IMAGE` and
`IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK`doesn't matter for the functional tests,
and they are set with different values in the python2 job.

Change-Id: I49ff241793f42de0f0cc9d98ae1f99940e581dcb

commit_message:
nodepool/elements : use abstracted commands

On platforms such as CentOS 8 which are python3 first, "virtualenv"
and "pip" may not exist (removed to avoid any confusion over them
being v2 or v3 commands).

The referenced dib change exports new variables that should be correct
on all platforms for creating virtualenv's and pip installs.

(note will require DIB release to be active on builders)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684462
Change-Id: I3414fb9e503f94ff744b560eff9ec0f4afdbb50e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 03:07:27.000000000', 'message': "infra-package-needs: fix haveged install for all CentOS releases

We've never really tested any of this on RHEL, so remove that match
(also, rhel7 element is deprecated for the version-less rhel element).

The CentOS elements export $YUM to be either dnf/yum as appropriate,
so use that behind the distro check where it will be defined.

Change-Id: I3dc18b2f7b6a624719a5f8d7d8b888c69fc0ac2b
"}]
commit_message:
infra-package-needs: fix haveged install for all CentOS releases

We've never really tested any of this on RHEL, so remove that match
(also, rhel7 element is deprecated for the version-less rhel element).

The CentOS elements export $YUM to be either dnf/yum as appropriate,
so use that behind the distro check where it will be defined.

Change-Id: I3dc18b2f7b6a624719a5f8d7d8b888c69fc0ac2b

subject: zuul-worker: no selinux python2 libs on CentOS 8
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-10-09 03:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-09 05:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-09 06:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-10-10 15:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 03:07:27.000000000', 'message': 'zuul-worker: no selinux python2 libs on CentOS 8

There are no libselinux bindings for Python 2 on CentOS 8 [1].  The
Python 3 packages are there as part of the base install.

These are required for Ansible to run correctly.  We will need to set
ansible_python_interpreter to python3 for CentOS 8 until
auto-detection is complete with [2].

[1] https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=16458
[2] https://review.opendev.org/682797

Change-Id: I52eef3069fa8699cc72b423d476c92b339600c23
'}]
commit_message:
zuul-worker: no selinux python2 libs on CentOS 8

There are no libselinux bindings for Python 2 on CentOS 8 [1].  The
Python 3 packages are there as part of the base install.

These are required for Ansible to run correctly.  We will need to set
ansible_python_interpreter to python3 for CentOS 8 until
auto-detection is complete with [2].

[1] https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=16458
[2] https://review.opendev.org/682797

Change-Id: I52eef3069fa8699cc72b423d476c92b339600c23

commit_message:
infra-pkg-needs: Update pkg-maps for CentOS 8, select chronyd

These images are Python3 only -- no python-dev

The ntp tools are replaced with chrony on CentOS 8, select it instead.
Update the service enablement too.  I have done a quick audit and
I don't believe any of our base job parts rely on ntpdate as such
(except for deprecated devstack-gate; there is actually an
unmerged ancient change! [1]).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/352674/1/functions.sh

Change-Id: Id2dbda7f114de0be4e4227da179490a17a22eb24

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ieaf284357518c4596e85745dbbf9aeb35e17e3b1

subject: Add shared arg in metaclass Lock
messages:
[{'account_id': 25837, 'date': '2019-09-05 03:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-23 12:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yup, all the implementations of this have that argument. Suprised abc allows this, tbh'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-10-10 13:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Python and ABC allow methods who inherited from a given abstract method to override the signature of this one, in other words it's not forbidden [1] like with principles like LSP [2].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/abc.html#abc.abstractmethod
[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liskov_substitution_principle"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 03:17:22.000000000', 'message': "Add shared arg in metaclass Lock

Add the missing arg 'shared' in the abstract method 'acquire' of
the metaclass 'Lock'.

Change-Id: I8572b0df2615f8f6e8f666be988b49e63a549679
"}]
commit_message:
Add shared arg in metaclass Lock

Add the missing arg 'shared' in the abstract method 'acquire' of
the metaclass 'Lock'.

Change-Id: I8572b0df2615f8f6e8f666be988b49e63a549679

commit_message:
Ensure mariadb packages are not in the lxc base image for debian

Debian ships a mariadb version which conflicts with the packages
installed by the galera_server role, so ensure these are absent from the
lxc base image.

Change-Id: Ic903de777d3d28962885fe4b73a3bf61a8d196f6

stable/train.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on

Python psutil library has not been consistent in behavior

commit_message:
Fix psutil inconsistencies

Python psutil library has not been consistent in behavior
a. gives trucated process names at times
b. the truncated names sometimes contain path to Python instead
of the program name Python runs

Change-Id: I99b77a4c28761a2187e59be4e562d5893ef3caa9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 21:24:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add --cpuset-cpus support for both Docker and Podman

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22
(cherry picked from commit d6ae074d2567b638fccd32868f6421de4044fbbe)

commit_message:
Add --cpuset-cpus support

Limit the specific CPUs or cores a container can use.

If cpuset-cpus is configured in the container layout, then the value
will be used when running the container cli with --cpuset-cpus.
If 'all' is used as a value, we'll then take all available cpus,
computed by: "0-" + str(psutil.cpu_count()-1)

If unset (default), the cpuset-cpus value is computed by using psutil with a
new function which returns a comma-separated list range of CPUs that a
container can use.

This parameter is particulary useful for NFV:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1750781
Indeed, for NFV workloads, in order to achieve 0 packet loss, linux processes,
ovs-dpdk (if applicable) and VMs are isolated thanks to kernel args (isolcpus)
and tuned profiles (cpu-partitioning).

Change-Id: I9443ad60affe9c7823b17daa259efee542c6fe22
(cherry picked from commit d6ae074d2567b638fccd32868f6421de4044fbbe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-04 11:45:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver (redo)

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 19.7 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 14.9 for 50%ile

The same thing has been done for Trunk deletion.

This reverts commit 2e0832f7b8bfc31780b657aa0abda4e8b244fbbd

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/trunk.py#L37

Change-Id: I6b659cbede25f271fa3b6a1c9e72019694ab6608
Closes-Bug: #1834637
Co-authored-by: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-10-04 11:45:52.000000000', 'message': 'Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver (redo)

'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 09:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver (redo)

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 35.6 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 34.2 for 50%ile

commit_message:
Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver (redo)

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 35.6 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 34.2 for 50%ile

The same thing has been done for Trunk deletion.

This reverts commit 2e0832f7b8bfc31780b657aa0abda4e8b244fbbd

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/trunk.py#L37

Change-Id: I6b659cbede25f271fa3b6a1c9e72019694ab6608
Closes-Bug: #1834637
Related-Bug: #1845479
Co-authored-by: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ied7426930822803a6bc0f4e43028805bdcda2aee

commit_message:
Replace wget with curl

Using wget can lead to problems because it's not default.
We should use curl instead

Change-Id: Idc859c57582ed3b83c6177e91e14ba4828311826
Closes-Bug: #1847344

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 15:34:59.000000000', 'message': 'Release octavia-dashboard RC2 for Train

This release is being proposed to pick up translations and bugfixes
that have merged to stable/train but not been released.

Not all changes are critical to make it into the initial Train
coordinated release and can wait until a stable release later. If
this patch does not get an ack from the PTL and/or release liaison
by EOD Thursday it will just be abandoned.

commit_message:
grub configuration should use user kernel & ramdisk

compared with pxe_config.template, ramdisk boot with grub should use
aki_path and ari_path

Change-Id: Ibedf375cfeeb20917f06e52b1e86a6990a3c494b
Story: 2006639
Task: 36855
(cherry picked from commit 2364c8b247899f8ac9fb42b53a070db2ea50a2e0)

subject: Add specified vip address when create vip

Hi,Maciej,
I had try to run ut just as you suggested,but i found that,"create_port" could not be called . I think the reason could be for "get_network_driver" method is an dynamic driver manager, not a static import. The following is my code,could you give some advice. Many thanks!

    def test_create_vip_port(self, net_dr):
        
        expected_dict={'port': {'name': 'ovn-lb-vip-' + str(self.loadbalancer_id),
                                'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': self.vip_dict['vip_subnet_id'],
                                               'ip_address':'10.1.10.1'}],
                                'network_id': self.vip_dict['vip_network_id'],
								'admin_state_up':True,'project_id':self.project_id}}
        
        with mock.patch.object(ovn_driver, 'get_network_driver') as gn:
            self.vip_dict['vip_address']='10.1.10.1'

            self.helper.create_vip_port(self.project_id,
                                        self.loadbalancer_id,
                                        self.vip_dict)
  
            gn.neutron_client.create_port.assert_called_once_with(expected_dict)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> Hi,Maciej,
 > I had try to run ut just as you suggested,but i found
 > that,"create_port" could not be called . I think the reason could
 > be for "get_network_driver" method is an dynamic driver manager,
 > not a static import. The following is my code,could you give some
 > advice. Many thanks!
 > 
 > def test_create_vip_port(self, net_dr):
 > 
 > expected_dict={'port': {'name': 'ovn-lb-vip-' + str(self.loadbalancer_id),
 > 'fixed_ips': [{'subnet_id': self.vip_dict['vip_subnet_id'],
 > 'ip_address':'10.1.10.1'}],
 > 'network_id': self.vip_dict['vip_network_id'],
 > 'admin_state_up':True,'project_id':self.project_id}}
 > 
 > with mock.patch.object(ovn_driver, 'get_network_driver') as gn:
 > self.vip_dict['vip_address']='10.1.10.1'
 > 
 > self.helper.create_vip_port(self.project_id,
 > self.loadbalancer_id,
 > self.vip_dict)
 > 
 > gn.neutron_client.create_port.assert_called_once_with(expected_dict)

Hey

I'll do something like this:
expected_call = [ 
   mock.call().neutron_client.create_port(expected_dict)]
gn.assert_has_calls(expected_call)

And this call is found. The whole test could be like this:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/754424/'}, {'account_id': 29874, 'date': '2019-07-16 10:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 29874, 'date': '2019-07-16 11:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-07-16 14:09:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2019-07-03 09:49:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add specified vip address when create vip

It is invalid when create lb with parameter " --vip-address".
This patch add vip address to vip_port in create_vip_port method.

Because of no unit for all octavia driver, so i can not add one for
this patch, when global unit frame is ok, i will add one for this patch.

Change-Id: Iafe54a3bfe75a0e15c57b34b9a714dd853890a2f
Closes-Bug: #1835184

commit_message:
Add specified vip address when create vip

It is invalid when create lb with parameter " --vip-address".
This patch add vip address to vip_port in create_vip_port method.

Change-Id: Iafe54a3bfe75a0e15c57b34b9a714dd853890a2f
Closes-Bug: #1835184

commit_message:
Fix error in parsing nic config with duplicate quotes

Network config of stack preview result is parsed based on
single quote at the end. With the conversion of network
config to ansible, there are many single quotes on the
network config preview. It results in partial network
config, resulting in yaml load failure. Fix the end of
network config parsing with more relevant code in
run_os_net_config.sh

Change-Id: Ib9ace4eca95c68c9641f3cbbe9b5f868ea49d211

commit_message:
Release magnum RC2 for Train

This release is being proposed to pick up translations and bugfixes
that have merged to stable/train but not been released.

Not all changes are critical to make it into the initial Train
coordinated release and can wait until a stable release later. If
this patch does not get an ack from the PTL and/or release liaison
by EOD Thursday it will just be abandoned.

Teams may also choose to -1 this patch and update it once any final
commits merge prior to the October 10 deadline.

Change-Id: I48adba327b23f59b5e77c9d4e7df9fba05b45933

commit_message:
Release compute-hyperv RC2 for Train

This release is being proposed to pick up translations and bugfixes
that have merged to stable/train but not been released.

Not all changes are critical to make it into the initial Train
coordinated release and can wait until a stable release later. If
this patch does not get an ack from the PTL and/or release liaison
by EOD Thursday it will just be abandoned.

Teams may also choose to -1 this patch and update it once any final
commits merge prior to the October 10 deadline.

Change-Id: Ide6203cdf80f5bc55abe162a7f4bbc72d0e9c054

commit_message:
Avoid race between pod creation retry and namespace deletion

This patch ensure that if a namespace gets deleted and there is
a pending pod creation retry, the later will not fail due to the
subnet being already deleted.

Change-Id: I914109337066441a2750d055aec5cf0e799d7516
Closes-Bug: 1847446

Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Remove unncessary "=="

Change-Id: Iaf5e16f73c47510ee386b8730ea2e63881ba62da

commit_message:
Fix signet pin

Missing a .0 in the semver so ~> would parse 0.11 like
11 could be increased. Also move it above to be cleaner.

Change-Id: I8b14c726305edf24d117f85d357e4b8f4945ec9f

[{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-20 16:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-20 16:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

we should have also some level for: only deployment tested vs more sophisticated tests

then we could cover k-a at once

and what about marking images for tripleo?'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-08-20 17:14:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > we should have also some level for: only deployment tested vs more
 > sophisticated tests
 > 
 > then we could cover k-a at once
 > 
 > and what about marking images for tripleo?

Well, I guess TripleO would need to mark images as they use it - I don't like to do reverse engineering.
Around deployment vs sophisticated tests - I feel we should cover it in detail in k-a docs. Trying to create a holistic view will not help I guess.
My idea would be to describe tests service by service in k-a, or role by role - while in Kolla we should cover images (distros and build types) - if they are buildable or not, and if they are linked to a k-a CI job that checks if k-a code + k image = working service.

Around Community Supported - this was the wording from PTG/whiteboard, but I also feel Community Maintained makes more sense :-)"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-21 07:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

All right. For details see k-a. Sweet.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-21 11:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had a quick go at adding a command to output a support matrix from the CLI.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/774836/

It works, but does not collapse down multiple images into one service. It could be done, but would get more complicated. We'd also need a way to define which images to promote from C to M or S."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

 > from the CLI.
 >

 > 
 > It works, but does not collapse down multiple images into one
 > service. It could be done, but would get more complicated. We'd
 > also need a way to define which images to promote from C to M or S.

Well, with some work added we could dump a csv and render it in docs using csv-table or a list-table. I think we could survive having a non-collapsed list, if we had a subpage per arch. Still promoting images to M or T require some additional data, which we would need to maintain I think - similar to UNBUILDABLE."}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-09-11 08:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Support matrix for Kolla

* Created support matrix for x86_64 and aarch64
* Populated with buildable vs unbuildable images
* Populated with images tested by k-a marked by T

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Sem-Ver: feature

(3 comments)

One bug in there, albeit in code that's not currently called. A couple of opportunities for simplification exist once that's fixed.

Please also add a release note.

I'm going to ask keystone folks to sanity-check this approach as well. (I like it.)"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-09-11 17:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

OK, apologies for not doing this sooner, but I checked with the Keystone team and unfortunately there's a problem with this approach that we'll have to work around:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2019-09-11.log.html#t2019-09-11T16:28:41

Basically any character (including @) is allowed in a user/group/role/project/domain name. And in particular it's not only possible but extremely likely that there are people out there using email addresses as user names.

I think we have an @ in the domain covered at this stage, because we're only splitting on the first @.

We could handle an @ in the username when no domain is specified by looking up the domain, and if that fails falling back to looking up the whole username string. That still might fail when only the username is specified if e.g. the username is u@example.com and there is an example.com domain; the way to fix that would be to fall back to the original string even if the domain is found but the user is found.

To handle an email-style username appearing with a domain then we'd need to try splitting on the first @, and if that fails split on the second.

Alternatively, we could try using a different and less likely character [sequence] as the delimiter. Puppet-openstack uses "user::domain" (mainly because that's common for puppet though). Maybe "user|domain"? Or "user{domain}"? I quite like that last one actually.

The only truly bulletproof way, and what the keystone team recommend, would be to add separate domain properties. However, I still think allowing domains in existing fields is on balance the most practical approach, since there's no way to do validation that requires data from multiple properties/parameters.'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-12 13:03:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

@Zane Bitter, thanks for these updates, good points. I'll update the implementation. Will ask any questions in IRC"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-14 01:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: -Code-Review

Remove the+2 to honor Zane’s comments'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-17 15:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I will implement  "user{domain}" that seems to be safest and easy to implement'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-19 18:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-20 06:31:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

your test didn't update accordingly, also please kindly add releasenote for this change"}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-23 14:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-23 14:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-09-24 12:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
Support domain in keystone lookups

Implements: User, group, role and project lookup across domains.
Added domain parameter to keystone lookup functions.
Heat templates now support user{domain}, group{domain},
role{domain} and project{domain} to support cross domain
lookup. Keystone constrains will also work across domain.

Release note added.

Story: 2005523
Task: 30642

Change-Id: I2b02787bd8883ced631b81174cee9134445bf170

commit_message:
Quote the health check command argument during a debug with print-cmd.

This is one of the few arguments that sometimes requires the use of
spaces. `paunch debug --action print-cmd` will now display a command
to stdout that can be copied, pasted, and executed reliability.

Change-Id: I04d2f141370cd88787422d6adf4b22cc54ecf028
Resolves: rhbz#1694572
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

Will take a closer look later.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-08-22 12:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-08-22 12:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-08-22 12:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-08-22 13:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:20:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Looks good, Donny.

All, here's the rendered page: https://5a5a7cb8621b3e4d9d72-094cda049386b2d4a7faf26afa0c7bce.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/677715/6/check/openstack-tox-docs/e743170/docs/ 

In particular, we'll need to review the support matrix:
https://5a5a7cb8621b3e4d9d72-094cda049386b2d4a7faf26afa0c7bce.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/677715/6/check/openstack-tox-docs/e743170/docs/reference/support-matrix.html"}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I really just need some specifics on the drivers and I think this is good to go.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 11:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

That was supposed to be for patchset 6 - I really just need some specifics on the drivers and I think this is good to go.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 12:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

At a high level, I think we should have a table of VM operations supported by Cyborg: Create/delete VMs, reboot within VM, soft/hard reboots etc. The list is in [1]. Generally, support for these operations would be generic (common to all drivers) but, there could be driver-specific notes in that table if there are caveats or notes. In Train, this table would have a big caveat that these work only with specific Nova patches.

Secondly, we probably need some documentation on concepts like device profiles for operators and ARQs for developers.

For the driver support matrix, I have a hard time imagining what goes in there. Others are welcome to pipe in.

Also, we need a through review of what we have. Some things that stand out:
1. What is the fate of api_samples/deployables? 
2. Need to update driver dev guide.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/server_concepts.html'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 18:59:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Q:'cloud operators'
A:This is a proper noun, so in English proper nouns should be capitalized

Q:Why not just call it Cyborg throughout? Different names/phrases for the service may confuse readers.
A:Because we should call it by it's service name, not code name. That name is only relevant to those who develop it. 
We should change all the references to Accelerator Service

Q:May be we should change this file name to 'installation_with_pip', the other being installation from git.
A:Yes, it makes sense to make the doc name fall in line with install from git"}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 19:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 20:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 23:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 23:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 23:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-26 23:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

The accelerator concepts doc is a direct copy from nova, so not sure why it didn't "just work". This doc space is to describe the basic concepts of the accelerator service and states it can have.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-27 00:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-09-27 00:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

Merged changes from patchset 12 and added more functions to the driver support matrix'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-09-27 01:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-09-30 07:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2019-09-30 09:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Thanks, LGTM with a NIT.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-01 12:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-01 12:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

NIT fixed. This should be ready to roll'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-01 21:25:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Good refactor. I have some issues with the content, but that's not for this patch."}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:04:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Fixed maxdepth on the main index and config guide index.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Donny Davis <donny@fortnebula.com>
'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-02 12:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

Yup, that's it, thanks Donny."}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2019-10-03 08:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

> NIT fixed. This should be ready to roll

Thanks,LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-10-03 13:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

> I have some issues with the content

If it is about the VM operations section, please LUK.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-10-03 13:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

The patch looks overall good to me and has got better. I am still not sold on the FPGA/GPU driver op stuff: neither the operator nor the end user can do things like 'create accelerator' or 'delete accelerator'. Most other ops that can be useful, such as pre-load bitstreams, are not supported yet."}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-03 14:43:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

'create accelerator' or 'delete accelerator' is content, which can be fixed. But the purpose of this patch isn't content, the purpose is doc organization and formatting."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-10-03 15:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

We can update this with follow-up patches as needed.'}, {'account_id': 20754, 'date': '2019-10-03 15:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

messages:
[{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-09 09:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-09 14:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-09 14:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-09 15:01:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2019-10-09 16:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2019-10-09 16:18:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-10-10 07:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-10-10 12:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 7444eab6494af92dc75ecb5c47e8f1f0299fbf61'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 09:42:30.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event

Change-Id: I14fcf820d94319541dd7bf13893e82cf0373969c
Closes-Bug: 1847453
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 14:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event

In case of a kuryr-controller restart, if the namespace deletion
event was already executed and it is retriggered, it can make the
kuryr-controller fail as the kuryrnet CRD would have been already
deleted and we cannot obtain the subnet id from it. In that case
the event just need to be skip.

Change-Id: I14fcf820d94319541dd7bf13893e82cf0373969c
Closes-Bug: 1847453
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid namespace deletion error if processing a duplicated event

In case of a kuryr-controller restart, if the namespace deletion
event was already executed and it is retriggered, it can make the
kuryr-controller fail as the kuryrnet CRD would have been already
deleted and we cannot obtain the subnet id from it. In that case
the event just need to be skip.

Change-Id: I14fcf820d94319541dd7bf13893e82cf0373969c
Closes-Bug: 1847453

commit_message:
Updating pip packages. Enabling VBoxSVGA driver.

- The latest VirtualBox versions warn the user about obsolete VGA driver,
thus the modified ovf file.
- Updated pip requirements and cirros image
- Updated Changelog and Readme about version 6 compatibility

Change-Id: I5e4d22634dd49d05eac22f7660fa1ea8bc8ca452

bionic.  This patchset updates it to python3 (without a subversion) so
that it works across xenial and bionic.

NOTE: this commit reverses (in tox.ini) the removal of py35 and py36 tox

"}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini so that pep8 uses python3

The pep8 target used to use python3.5, which doesn't normally exist on
bionic.  This patchset updates it to python3 (without a subversion) so
that it works across xenial and bionic.

NOTE: this commit reverses (in tox.ini) the removal of py35 and py36 tox
targets, as they are still used on OSCI.

Change-Id: If329a631551f4e3d1b1839a91bdb18e98945bda9

If qemu guest agent is not reponsive when set admin password
, an InternalError will be thrown
and the VM state will be set to ERROR.

Actually we did nothing to VMs.
Also, we've already catched this exception in compute.manager.

This patch checks the return code from libvirt
and throws NotImplementedError if qga is not responsive.

Change-Id: I4603711c435e15593e4a979906a12b560737bd77
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>
